6.02.010: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this chapter:
GARBAGE: Includes and means kitchen and table refuse, offal, swill, and other
accumulation of animal, vegetable and other matter that attends to the
preparation and consumption, decay, or dealing in, or storage of meats, fish,
fowl, birds, fruits, vegetables, printed matter, paper, boxes, rags, straw,
glass, glassware, ashes, metals, tin containers and grass.
TRASH: Includes and means wood, leaves, dead trees, the branches of trees, and
woodenware.
WASTE MATTER: Includes and means natural soil, clay, earth, sand, gravel, loam,
manure, stones, bricks, plaster, cement and crockery. (Ord. 11/6/74 §1, 1974)
6.02.020: FRANCHISE; GENERALLY:
   A.   This franchise establishes an exclusive right to collect, haul and
dispose of garbage.
   B.   The franchisee, its successors or assigns shall have the privilege of
collecting, hauling and disposing of garbage subject to the limitations now or
hereafter provided by law.
   C.   The county reserves the right to alter and amend this chapter in any
manner necessary for the safety or welfare of the public, or to protect public
interests, and to cancel the franchise for failure to perform in accordance
with this chapter and the franchise agreement. (Ord. 11/6/74 §2, 1974)
6.02.030: FRANCHISE; APPLICATION:
Any person desiring to apply for said franchise shall submit a proposal, in
writing, to the county clerk, attach a financial statement to the proposal to
demonstrate the financial stability of the bidder, and satisfy all other
requirements set forth in this chapter. (Ord. 11/6/74 §3, 1974)
6.02.040: FRANCHISE; TERM:
Effective November 20, 1974, the franchise shall be granted for a period of
five (5) years, with an option for renewal of an additional five (5) years, as
an exclusive franchised service, to that person or persons offering the best
and most advantageous terms to White Pine County. (Ord. 11/6/74 §4, 1974)
6.02.050: FRANCHISE; AGREEMENT:
The franchise granted under this chapter shall not become effective until a
written agreement is entered into between the successful bidder and White Pine
County. (Ord. 11/6/74 §5, 1974)
6.02.060: FRANCHISE; REQUIREMENTS GENERALLY:
The franchisee shall be required to perform as set out in sections
6.02.070 through
 6.02.160 of this chapter. (Ord. 11/6/74 §6(part), 1974)
6.02.070: FRANCHISEE; GARBAGE COLLECTION DUTIES:
The franchisee shall be required to:
   A.   Guarantee that garbage service shall be available to the residents of
the town of Ruth, town of McGill and to residents residing within one mile on
each side of the McGill Highway and the Ruth Highway at all times, and that all
garbage within this specified area shall be removed in an expeditious manner
and in accordance with the terms of the franchise;
   B.   Collect garbage from all residences, multi-residences, business
locations, public places and any other locations wherever situated in the town
of Ruth, town of McGill, and within one mile on each side of the McGill Highway
and Ruth Highway at least once a week. If desired, collections may be requested
on a regular basis two (2) times a week, three (3) times a week or six (6)
times a week. If a request for additional service, either regular, intermittent
or isolated, is made, the franchisee shall provide such additional regular,
intermittent or isolated service. The only exception to the requirement that
garbage be collected once a week at residences shall be garbage pick up once a
month for those persons who apply with the franchisee for a permit allowing
garbage collection only once a month. The permit shall be allowed only upon
approval by the city-county district health department of White Pine County;
   C.   Guarantee that in the collection of garbage from any location in the
town of Ruth, town of McGill, and within one mile on each side of the McGill
Highway and the Ruth Highway, care shall be taken to deposit all garbage inside
the collection truck, leaving no evidence or bits within said area or on any
private property used for the collection of garbage;
   D.   Provide safe, adequate and clean equipment which is constructed in such
a manner as to be completely covered so as to prevent sifting, spilling,
dripping or blowing of any of the garbage contained therein upon any of the
streets, alleys or public places in the town of Ruth, town of McGill, or within
one mile on each side of the McGill Highway and Ruth Highway. The equipment
used by the franchisee shall be adequate and watertight. The outside of the
equipment shall be kept free from dirt, and the inside of the garbage carriers
shall be thoroughly cleaned at the end of each day;
   E.   Guarantee that the operators of the equipment shall use decent
language, be sober and treat the public courteously at all times;
   F.   Vehicles and containers used for the collection and transportation of
garbage and similar putrescible waste shall be tightly covered, leakproof,
durable and of easily cleanable construction. Such vehicles and containers
shall be cleaned frequently to prevent nuisance and insect breeding, and shall
be maintained in good repair. (Ord. 11/6/74 §6(1), 1974)
6.02.080: CITY DUMP SITES; REQUIREMENTS:
The franchisee shall be required to provide at least one suitable location as a
city dump site for the purposes of dumping and burying garbage, as well as
trash and waste matter. For this purpose, the city shall make available to the
franchisee the east one-half of the northwest one-quarter of section ten,
township 16 north, range 63 east, M.D.B. & M., owned by the city, for the
disposal of garbage, trash and waste matter. In addition, the franchisee may
request the city council to designate, in writing, such other city dump sites
as may be advisable. In no event, however, shall the franchisee be required to
make available for use by the public more than one city dump site. The
franchisee shall not be entitled to use any city dump site, whether the one
described above or such other city dump sites as may be designated by the city
council, for any other purpose than dumping or burying garbage, trash and waste
matter. Citizens and residents of the town of Ruth, town of McGill, and within
one mile on each side of the McGill Highway and the Ruth Highway, shall be
entitled to haul and dump their own trash and waste matter on any and all city
dump sites made available by the franchisee, passes for which will be furnished
by the franchisee to those customers who have kept account with the franchisee
current. All garbage, trash and waste matter deposited on any and all city dump
sites shall be buried in the landfill method prescribed by state law. Any and
all city dump sites, whether made available to the public or not, shall be kept
free of all paper and other material, shall not be allowed to become
unsanitary, filthy or dangerous to the health of the general public, and shall
be kept in the condition required by the laws of the state and the city-county
district health department of White Pine County. Any and all city dump sites
shall be maintained in a manner so as to prohibit or limit access to a dump
site, by means of fences or other similar methods. The franchisee shall have
the right to all salvage of any matter whatsoever that may be collected from
any and all city dump sites, however deposited thereon. (Ord. 11/6/74 §6(2)(a),
1974)
6.02.090: CITY DUMP SITES; DUMPING RATES:
The rates for dumping trash and waste matter by nonsubscribers and commercial
at any and all city dump sites made available by the franchisee shall be as
follows:
Automobiles                                              $7.50 each
Hazardous material                                       $5.00 per cubic yard
                                                         $5.00 minimum charge
Large bulky items (stoves, refrigerators, mattresses,    $1.00 per item
etc.)
Liquid waste (septic tank dumping, vault toilet pick up) $0.01 per gallon
                                                         $5.00 minimum charge
Private vehicles and private pickups                     $1.00 per load
Tires                                                    $0.10 each
Tree stumps, limbs, etc., cut to 5 foot length           $0.50 per cubic yard
 
These rates shall be posted at each and every dump site. There shall be no
change in such rates unless first approved by ordinance and then posted at each
and every dump site. (Ord. 11/6/74 §6(2)(b), 1974)
6.02.100: CITY DUMP SITES; OPERATION HOURS:
Winter operation hours (October through March) shall be from eight o'clock (8:
00) A.M. to five o'clock (5:00) P.M., and summer operation hours (April through
September) shall be from eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. to eight o'clock (8:00) P.M.
(Ord. 11/6/74 §6(2)(c), 1974)
6.02.110: FRANCHISEE; RECORDS:
The franchisee shall be required to keep itemized accounts of all collections
received under the privileges of this franchise, including the date the fee was
charged, the amount of the fee, the date the fee was collected, and from whom
the fee was collected; and allow the city of Ely and the board of county
commissioners to inspect, at all reasonable times, the books and records
pertaining to all business done under the franchise at any time. (Ord. 11/6/74
§6(3), 1974)
6.02.120: FRANCHISEE; CITY AND COUNTY NONLIABILITY GUARANTEE; INSURANCE:
The franchisee shall be required to guarantee that in the exercise of duties
under the franchise, every reasonable and proper precaution to avoid damage or
injury to persons or property shall be used, and that the franchisee shall, at
all times and under all circumstances, hold and save the city and the county
harmless from each and all such damage, injury, loss or expense caused or
occasioned by reason of any act or failure to act of the franchisee, its
officers, agents and employees. The franchisee further agrees that if the city
or county is sued by any person or business of any kind to recover damages for
injury to any person or property on account of actions during performance of
duties under the franchise, the franchisee, its successors and assigns shall
defend all such suits and pay all judgment or judgments any court or courts may
enter in such suits. Further, it shall be required to provide liability
insurance in a minimum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) and three
hundred thousand dollars ($300,000.00) coverage and one hundred thousand
dollars ($100,000.00) property damage. (Ord. 11/6/74 §6(4), 1974)
6.02.130: FRANCHISEE; BOND OR TIME CERTIFICATE:
The franchisee shall be required to provide a performance bond or time
certificate in the amount of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00) to assure
faithful performance of the requirements of the franchise, said bond or time
certificate to be subject to the approval of the district attorney of White
Pine County, Nevada. (Ord. 11/6/74 §6(5), 1974)
6.02.140: FRANCHISE; TERMINATION:
The franchisee shall be required to agree that in the event the franchisee
fails to perform any condition of the franchise, or fails to abide by all laws,
rules and regulations pertaining to the franchise, or becomes bankrupt or
insolvent, the county shall have the right to terminate the franchise and
agreement so awarded if the franchisee fails to correct the deficiency within
thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice from county. (Ord. 11/6/74 §6
(6), 1974)
6.02.150: FRANCHISE; ASSIGNABILITY:
The franchisee shall be required to agree that no assignment of the franchise
shall be made without the written consent of the board of county commissioners
being first had and obtained. (Ord. 11/6/74 §6(7), 1974)
6.02.160: FRANCHISEE; ACCOUNTABLE TO COUNTY:
The franchisee shall be required to agree to be responsible to the county clerk
or other officials designated by the board of county commissioners. (Ord. 11/6/
74 §6(8), 1974)
6.02.170: CHARGES GENERALLY:
Under this franchise, the franchisee shall charge the rates set out in sections
6.02.180 through
6.02.220 of this chapter. (Ord. 11/6/74 §7(part), 1974)
6.02.180: RESIDENTIAL COLLECTION CHARGES:
Every person from whom garbage is collected shall be charged the sum of four
dollars fifty cents ($4.50) per month for three (3) receptacles not exceeding
thirty eight (38) gallons in capacity per receptacle. There shall be an
additional charge of fifty cents ($0.50) per month for each additional
receptacle of the capacity of thirty eight (38) gallons or fraction thereof.
For additional collections of garbage during the week on a regular basis, the
fees shall be those set forth in the schedule for "business establishments" in
section 6.02.190 of this chapter. Those persons from whom one can of garbage is
collected per month shall be charged the sum of one dollar fifty cents ($1.50)
per month. (Ord. 11/6/74 §7(1), 1974)
6.02.190: BUSINESS ESTABLISHMENT COLLECTION CHARGES:
Every person for whom garbage is collected under the provisions of this
franchise shall be charged for the collection of garbage in receptacles not
exceeding thirty eight (38) gallons in capacity, the following monthly sums of
money:
