(Ord. 11/6/74 §7(2), 1974)
6.02.200: COLLECTION CHARGES; SPECIAL INTERMITTENT OR ISOLATED SERVICES:
If the franchisee receives a request for isolated or intermittent service not
in conjunction with regular service collection, the charge shall be a minimum
of seven dollars fifty cents ($7.50) plus three dollars fifteen cents ($3.15)
for each cubic yard of garbage collected. (Ord. 11/6/74 §7(3), 1974)
6.02.210: COLLECTION CHARGES; BILLING; PAYMENT:
Bills for garbage service shall be for actual services only. The franchisee
shall bill in advance for the charges allowed by the franchise on a monthly
basis, and such charges shall be due and payable on the first day of each
billing period. The bill or charge shall be delinquent if not fully paid on the
last day of such monthly period. In case any person fails to pay the charges
within fifteen (15) days after the same became delinquent, a penalty of ten
percent (10%) of such charge shall be added thereto. All charges and all
penalties provided for in the franchise shall constitute a debt and obligation
of the owner and the person in control or management of the residences and
business establishments so served, and such person shall be liable therefor in
the event that the owner or person fails to advise the franchisee of the "ins
and outs" of said residents and business establishments. (Ord. 11/6/74 §7(4),
1974)
6.02.220: COLLECTION CHARGES; NONSPECIFIED SERVICES:
In the event that services are requested for a rate which has not been covered
by this code, the board of county commissioners may set the rate for such
service after a survey has been made of the service requested. Once such rates
have been established, they may be changed only after a public hearing before
and approved by the board of county commissioners. (Ord. 11/6/74 §7(5), 1974)
6.02.230: GARBAGE AND TRASH RECEPTACLES:
All garbage and/or trash receptacles for pick up shall be placed in drive
through alleys where the same are available, or on the curb where no alleys are
available.
The franchisee will continue to furnish services as heretofore, except for a
part of the Elysium Terrace where curb service will be required.
It shall be the duty of every householder and every person in charge of a
business where food is served or where garbage may accumulate to provide and at
all times keep on the premises occupied by him, or in his charge, suitable and
sufficient watertight cans.
Cans for garbage shall each have a tightfitting cover, and shall be adequate to
receive and hold, without leakage or escape of odors, all garbage which may
accumulate on the premises.
All residents desiring trash haulage by the franchisee shall box, bag or place
such in a receptacle near the garbage receptacles, for the charges set forth in
garbage collection rates. (Ord. 11/6/74 §8, 1974)
6.02.240: FRANCHISEE; PAYMENTS TO COUNTY:
The franchisee, its successors and assigns shall pay to the county, from the
date the franchise is effective, the sum of money set forth in the written
agreement between White Pine County and the franchisee. (Ord. 11/6/74 §9, 1974)
6.02.250: ADDITIONAL REGULATIONS:
This franchise shall be subject to the provisions of the constitution and the
laws of the state and all ordinances enacted by White Pine County, Nevada.
(Ord. 11/6/74 §10, 1974)
CHAPTER 6.03
GARBAGE DISPOSAL AT CITY LANDFILL
SECTION:
6.03.010: Definitions
6.03.020: General Provisions
6.03.030: Removal Of Garbage, Trash And Waste Matter
6.03.040: Designation Of City Landfill
6.03.050: Disposal Of Garbage, Trash And Waste Matter
6.03.060: Operation Of City Landfill
6.03.070: Collection By County
6.03.080: Billing For Landfill Fees
6.03.090: Failure To Remove Accumulations
6.03.100: Notices
6.03.110: Certain Acts Unlawful
6.03.120: Remedies Cumulative
6.03.130: County Commissioners To Make Regulations
6.03.140: Billing, Penalty For Delinquent Payments
6.03.150: Compliance With Other Laws
6.03.160: Violation And Penalty
6.03.010: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this chapter, the following terms and phrases shall have the
meanings ascribed to them in this section:
CITY LANDFILL: That certain sanitary landfill dumping area set aside by the
Council of the City of Ely for the sanitary disposal of garbage, trash and
waste matter, and such other sanitary landfill dumping area as the City Council
may in the future designate for the sanitary disposal of garbage, trash and
waste matter.
GARBAGE: Kitchen and table refuse, offal, swill and other accumulation of
animals, vegetables and other matter that attends the preparation and
consumption, decay or dealing in, or storage of meats, fish, fowl, birds,
fruits, vegetables, printed matter, paper, boxes, rags, straw, glass,
glassware, ashes, metals, tin containers and grass.
TRASH: Woods, leaves, dead trees, the branches of trees and woodenware.
WASTE MATTER: Natural soil, earth, sand, clay, gravel, loam, manure, stones,
bricks, plaster, cement and crockery. (Ord. 468, 2017: Ord. 10/11/77 §1, 1977)
6.03.020: GENERAL PROVISIONS:
   A.   All occupants of commercial and residential premises in the Towns of
Ruth and McGill, Nevada, and their respective environs, shall pay the rates for
dumping garbage, trash and waste matter as set forth in this chapter.
   B.   No person shall dump, place or bury on any lot, land, street, alley or
other public place, or in any water or waterway, or ditch, or elsewhere, any
garbage, trash or waste matter.
   C.   Nothing in this chapter contained shall be construed as prohibiting any
person from collecting and removing his own garbage, trash and waste matter,
provided, however, that in so doing, he shall be subject to all requirements of
this chapter as to hauling, place and manner of disposition and all similar
requirements. (Ord. 10/11/77 §2, 1977)
6.03.030: REMOVAL OF GARBAGE, TRASH AND WASTE MATTER:
All garbage, trash and waste matter shall be hauled and taken to the City
landfill in such manner so as to prevent the sifting, spilling, dropping or
blowing thereof, upon any of the streets, alleys or public places. (Ord. 468,
2017: Ord. 10/11/77 §3, 1977)
6.03.040: DESIGNATION OF CITY LANDFILL:
The City landfill is those City of Ely lands more particularly described as
follows: "E 1/2 NW 1/4, Section 10, Township 16 north, Range 63 E., M.D.M.",
and such other lands as the City of Ely may, by resolution from time to time
designate. (Ord. 468, 2017: Ord. 10/11/77 §4, 1977)
6.03.050: DISPOSAL OF GARBAGE, TRASH AND WASTE MATTER:
Every person hauling garbage, trash and waste matter shall dispose thereof only
at the City landfill site designated by the Council of the City of Ely and such
disposition shall be in accord with all provisions of law, rules and
regulations. (Ord. 468, 2017: Ord. 10/11/77 §5, 1977)
6.03.060: OPERATION OF CITY LANDFILL:
   A.   All dumping of any material of any nature or description, be it
garbage, trash or waste matter, shall be in conformity to the following
provisions:
      1.   Dumping shall be performed during, and access to the City landfill
limited to, only those hours of operation adopted from time to time by the
Council of the City of Ely and posted at the main entrance to the City
landfill.
      2.   All dumping of any material, of any nature or description, be it
garbage, trash or waste matter, and all access within the City landfill area
shall be at the direction of the City Landfill Operator.
      3.   There shall be no burning at the City landfill except under the
direction of the City Landfill Operator. (Ord. 468, 2017: Ord. 10/11/77 §6,
1977)
6.03.070: COLLECTION BY COUNTY:
The County Commissioners, by resolution, may carry out the provisions of this
chapter, and may thereunto charge, bill and collect fees for depositing
garbage, trash and waste matter upon the City landfill as required by this
chapter. All such fees so charged, billed and collected shall be paid over
annually, at the end of each and every calendar year, to the City of Ely by the
County Treasurer in payment for the use and operation of the City landfill,
except that the County may retain any amount thereof, which represents
administrative expenses incurred by the County in connection with such
imposition and collection of fees. (Ord. 468, 2017: Ord. 89 §1, 1980: Ord. 10/
11/77 §7, 1977)
6.03.080: BILLING FOR LANDFILL FEES:
County residents shall be responsible to pay the amounts properly billed to
them by the City of Ely for landfill fees. (Ord. 439, 2010)
6.03.090: FAILURE TO REMOVE ACCUMULATIONS:
If at any time, garbage, trash or waste matter is not hauled to the City
landfill, or draws flies or vermin, or insects, because an excess volume is
allowed to build up beyond that entirely contained within two (2) standard
sized garbage cans and accumulate on town-site property, a notice may issue
from the White Pine County Commission or from the Sheriff's Office, or those
other officers identified in section
6.29.104 of this title as an "enforcement official", to the property owner of
record. If, after notice from the County Commission or other "enforcement
official", the accumulation is not remedied within thirty (30) days of the date
of the notice, the County may proceed with all legal remedies provided by law
by either determining the accumulation a public nuisance and abating the same
pursuant to Nevada Revised Statutes 202.450-480, and/or by abating the nuisance
pursuant to chapters 6.29 and 6.30 of this title.
Prior to issuance of a notice, any citizen of White Pine County may present
evidence to the County Commission in a meeting of the Commission of the
existence of an accumulation of garbage, trash or waste matter and seek
abatement through issuance of the notice referred to in this section and
section
6.03.100 of this chapter. (Ord. 468, 2017)
6.03.100: NOTICES:
Notices to owners under any provision of this chapter may be given personally
or by registered mail addressed to the owner at his last known address or
address appearing on the tax rolls or otherwise, general delivery.
Anything in this chapter to the contrary notwithstanding, the owner shall be
responsible for removal of garbage, trash and waste matter from his premises
and for otherwise complying with the terms of this chapter, whether such owner
is in possession personally or through a tenant or otherwise, and whether the
same accrued during occupancy of the premises by the owner or by a tenant or
while vacant or otherwise. Nothing in this chapter shall be construed as
relieving from any civil or criminal liability the person actually responsible
for any violation of this chapter. (Ord. 10/11/77 §10, 1977)
6.03.110: CERTAIN ACTS UNLAWFUL:
It is unlawful for any person, other than a person to whom a contract shall
have been awarded or to whom a license shall have been granted by the County to
collect and remove garbage, trash and waste matter in or from the Towns of Ruth
and McGill, Nevada, and their respective environs, other than to haul his own
garbage, trash and waste matter as provided in this chapter. (Ord. 10/11/77
§11, 1977)
6.03.120: REMEDIES CUMULATIVE:
Any and all remedies provided in this chapter shall be deemed cumulative. The
county and the officers thereof shall in addition thereto have the right to
exercise and enforce all rights and remedies otherwise created or existing,
including the right of injunction, the right of abatement of nuisances, the
right of action for damages, and the right of prosecution for violation of any
of the provisions of this chapter. (Ord. 10/11/77 §12, 1977)
6.03.130: COUNTY COMMISSIONERS TO MAKE REGULATIONS:
The county commission is authorized to make any and all necessary or proper
regulations to carry out and enforce the provisions of this chapter, including
all matters as to notices, procedures and routes of travel. Owners hauling
their own garbage, trash and waste matter shall be bound by all such rules and
regulations of which notice may be given as required by the county commission,
and a violation of the requirements of such notices shall be deemed a violation
of this chapter punishable as provided in this chapter. (Ord. 10/11/77 §13,
1977)
6.03.140: BILLING, PENALTY FOR DELINQUENT PAYMENTS:
The county treasurer shall maintain a list showing all persons liable for the
charges provided in this chapter, and the treasurer shall issue bills therefor
and shall collect them the same as other county funds.
If any person fails or neglects, for the period of one month after billing, to
make payment of any proper charge against such person in conformity with the
schedule set out in this chapter, the same shall be considered delinquent and
such person shall be liable to the county, by way of penalty for such failure
or neglect, to a further and additional charge equal to ten percent (10%) of
such delinquent charge, and such penalty charge shall be added to such person's
bill, and, unless paid within one month thereafter, shall continue to
accumulate and be added monthly until full payments shall be made. (Ord. 10/11/
77 §14, 1977)
6.03.150: COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER LAWS:
This chapter shall be subject to the provisions of the constitution and the
laws of the state of Nevada and ordinances enacted by the county commission.
(Ord. 10/11/77 §16, 1977)
6.03.160: VIOLATION AND PENALTY:
Any person who violates the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty
of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction thereof shall be punished by a fine or by
imprisonment in the county jail or by both a fine and imprisonment. (Ord. 439,
2010)
CHAPTER 6.04
REFUSE 1
SECTION:
6.04.010: Short Title
6.04.020: Definitions
6.04.030: Collection; By Franchise Holder Required; Exception
6.04.040: Collection; Supervision By Sheriff
6.04.050: Precollection Practices
6.04.060: Collection; Frequency
6.04.070: Collection; Fees
6.04.080: Collection; Delinquent Accounts
6.04.090: Dump Franchise
 
Notes
1 1. NRS 244.187.
6.04.010: SHORT TITLE:
This chapter shall be known and cited as the WHITE PINE COUNTY REFUSE
COLLECTION ORDINANCE. (Ord. 33 §1, 1963)
6.04.020: DEFINITIONS:
For the purposes of this chapter the following terms, phrases, words, and their
derivations shall have the meanings given herein. When not inconsistent with
the context, words used in the present tense include the future, words in the
plural number include the singular, and words in the singular include the
plural. "Shall" is always mandatory and not merely directory:
AREAS: As used in this chapter, is the vicinity of the towns of East Ely,
McGill and Ruth, including therein all of the area comprising the Ely City
townsite and the Park Addition to the Ely City townsite, and also including an
area two (2) miles from the boundaries in all directions of these towns, as
well as an area two (2) miles in all directions from the city of Ely.
ASHES: The residue from the burning of wood, coal, coke, or other combustible
materials.
GARBAGE: Is putrescible animal and vegetable wastes resulting from the
handling, preparation, cooking, and consumption of food.
GRANTEE: The franchise holder whose rights and duties are defined by this title
and the present grantee is Ely Disposal Service, Inc., of Ely, Nevada, owned
and operated by Mrs. A. R. Myrtle Meecham and Mr. Ronald W. Meecham.
PERSON: Any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation, company or
organization of any kind.
REFUSE: All putrescible and nonputrescible solid wastes (except body wastes),
including garbage, rubbish, ashes, street cleanings, dead animals, abandoned
automobiles, and solid market and industrial wastes.
RUBBISH: Nonputrescible solid wastes (excluding ashes), consisting of both
combustible and noncombustible wastes, such as paper, cardboard, tin cans, yard
clippings, wood, glass, bedding, crockery and similar materials. (Ord. 7/5/73
§1, 1973: Ord. 33 §2, 1963)
6.04.030: COLLECTION; BY FRANCHISE HOLDER REQUIRED; EXCEPTION:
All "refuse" accumulated in the "areas" defined in section
6.04.020 of this chapter shall be collected, conveyed and disposed of by the
franchise holder, provided that such a franchise is granted by the board of
county commissioners.
Exception for actual producers: This chapter shall not prohibit the actual
producers of refuse, or the owners of premises upon which refuse has
accumulated, from collecting, conveying and disposing of such refuse, provided
such producers or owners comply with the provisions of this chapter and with
any other governing law or ordinances, and provided that permission therefor be
granted by the county sheriff. (Ord. 33 §3, 1963)
6.04.040: COLLECTION; SUPERVISION BY SHERIFF:
All "refuse" accumulated in the "areas" defined in section
6.04.020 of this chapter shall be collected, conveyed and disposed of as
provided herein and under the supervision of the sheriff. The sheriff shall
have the authority to make regulations concerning the days of collection, type
and location of waste containers and such other matters pertaining to the
collection and disposal as he shall find necessary, and to change and modify
the same after public notice by posting in the areas affected for a period of
ten (10) days.
   A.   Appeals: Any person aggrieved by a regulation of the sheriff as
provided herein shall have the right of appeal to the board of county
commissioners, who shall have the right and authority to confirm, modify or
revoke any such regulation. (Ord. 33 §4, 1963)
6.04.050: PRECOLLECTION PRACTICES:
   A.   Trimmings And Clippings: Tree trimmings, hedge clippings, wood, and
similar material shall be cut to a length not to exceed four feet (4').
   B.   Container Requirements: Container requirements shall be as follows:
      1.   Refuse containers shall be provided by the owner, tenant, lessee, or
occupant of the premises, to be maintained in a good and sanitary condition.
Any container that does not conform to the provisions of this chapter or that
may have ragged or sharp edges or any other defect liable to hamper or injure
the person collecting the contents thereof shall be promptly replaced upon
notice. The sheriff shall have the authority to refuse collection services for
failure to comply herewith;
      2.   All containers shall be of a kind suitable for collection purposes
and shall be of such weight that it can be handled by one man, with suitable
handles and tightfitting covers wherever reasonable and practical.
   C.   Storing Of Refuse: No person shall place any "refuse" in any street,
alley or other public place or upon any private property, whether owned by such
person or not, within the "areas" defined in section
6.04.020 of this chapter, except in proper containers as provided herein.
   D.   Refuse Burning Restrictions: Refuse burning restrictions shall be as
follows:
      1.   It is unlawful for any person to burn "refuse" within the "areas"
defined in section
 6.04.020 of this chapter, except at duly authorized refuse or garbage dumps;
      2.   This chapter shall not prohibit the burning of paper, cardboard
cartons and other similar materials; provided, that this material is burned in
properly screened incinerators. (Ord. 33 §5, 1963)
6.04.060: COLLECTION; FREQUENCY:
   A.   Residential: Refuse accumulated by residences shall be collected at
least once each week.
   B.   Commercial: Hotels, restaurants and such other businesses may enter
into an agreement for greater frequency of collection. Where necessary to
protect the public health, the sheriff shall have the authority to require that
more frequent collections be made. (Ord. 33 §6, 1963)
6.04.070: COLLECTION; FEES:
   A.   Residential: The fees for collection and disposal of refuse from each
residence shall be two dollars fifty cents ($2.50) per month for one collection
per week, and three dollars ($3.00) per month for two (2) collections per week.
   B.   Commercial: Commercial establishments and businesses shall be charged
the fee according to current charges or those presently in effect with the
"areas" defined in section
 6.04.020 of this chapter.
   C.   Extraordinary: The foregoing fee schedule is for the normal amount of
refuse collected. An additional fee may be charged for any extraordinary or
unusual amounts, sizes or bulk of refuse. (Ord. 49(part), 1968: Ord. 33 §7,
1963)
6.04.080: COLLECTION; DELINQUENT ACCOUNTS:
If a delinquent account is not paid within thirty (30) days, refuse collection
shall cease, unless otherwise directed by the sheriff. The stoppage by sheriff
for nonpayment of collection charges shall not prevent a franchise holder from
proceeding with the collection of refuse as is otherwise provided by law. (Ord.
33 §8, 1963)
6.04.090: DUMP FRANCHISE:
The franchise previously granted to the grantee is extended on and after June
1, 1974 until January 1, 1977, or until city/county dump facilities are
converted in accordance with state and federal regulation to landfill operation
whichever shall occur first, and that the franchise is extended subject to all
existing duties, privileges and fees contained in this chapter. (Ord. 7/5/73
§2, 1973)
CHAPTER 6.05
WHITE PINE REGIONAL SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL FACILITY
SECTION:
6.05.010: Establishment
6.05.020: Definitions
6.05.030: Description Of White Pine Regional Solid Waste Disposal Facility
6.05.035: Change Of Site Allowed
6.05.040: Description Of White Pine Regional Solid Waste Disposal Facility Area
6.05.050: General Provisions
6.05.060: Removal And Hauling Of Solid Waste
6.05.070: Disposal Of Solid Waste
6.05.080: Construction, Maintenance And Operation
6.05.090: Removal Of Solid Waste From Residential And Commercial Premises
6.05.110: Failure To Remove Solid Waste Accumulations
6.05.120: Notices
6.05.130: Assessment And Collection Of Fees
6.05.140: Amount Of Fees To Be Assessed
6.05.150: Collection And Disposal Of Solid Waste; Unlawful Acts
6.05.160: Remedies Cumulative
6.05.170: Power To Regulate
6.05.180: Exemption From Disposing Of Waste At White Pine Regional Solid Waste
Disposal Facility Landfill And Paying Fee
6.05.200: Compliance With Other Laws
6.05.210: Standard For Compliance With Federal And State Laws
6.05.220: Violation; Penalty
6.05.010: ESTABLISHMENT:
There is added to this code, a new chapter creating and establishing the White
Pine regional solid waste disposal facility. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.020: DEFINITIONS:
For the purposes of this chapter:
COUNTY: White Pine County.
SOLID WASTE: A. Commercial Solid Waste: All types of solid waste generated by
stores, offices, restaurants, warehouses and other nonmanufacturing activities,
excluding residential and industrial wastes.
   B.   Household Waste: Any solid waste, including garbage, trash and sanitary
waste in septic tanks derived from households, including single and multiple
residences, hotels and motels, bunkhouses, ranger stations, crew quarters,
campgrounds, picnic grounds, and day use recreation areas.
   C.   Industrial Solid Waste: Solid waste generated by manufacturing or
industrial processes that is not a hazardous waste, including, but not limited
to, waste resulting from electric power generation, fertilize/agricultural
chemicals, food and related products/byproducts, inorganic chemicals, iron and
steel manufacturing, leather and leather products, nonferrous metals
manufacturing/foundries, organic chemicals, plastics and resins manufacturing,
pulp and paper industry, rubber and miscellaneous rubber and miscellaneous
plastic products, stone, glass, clay and concrete products, textile
manufacturing, transportation equipment and water treatment, but not including
mining waste or oil and gas waste.
   D.   General Solid Waste: Any garbage or refuse, sludge from a wastewater
treatment plant, water supply treatment plant or air pollution control facility
and other discarded material, including solid, liquid, semisolid or contained
gaseous material resulting from industrial, commercial, mining, agricultural
operations and community activities, but not including solid or dissolved
materials in domestic sewage or solid or dissolved materials in irrigation
return flows or industrial discharges that are point sources subject to federal
permit, or source, special nuclear, or byproduct material as defined by the
atomic energy act of 1954, as amended (685 Stat. 923).
WHITE PINE REGIONAL SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL FACILITY: That certain sanitary solid
waste disposal site established by the White Pine County board of county
commissioners, state of Nevada, for the sanitary disposal of all solid waste
and such other sanitary solid waste disposal sites as the White Pine County
board of county commissioners may at a future date designate for the sanitary
disposal of solid waste.
WHITE PINE REGIONAL SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL FACILITY AREA: That area designated by
the White Pine County board of county commissioners to be served by the White
Pine regional solid waste disposal facility and assessed for the support
thereof. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.030: DESCRIPTION OF WHITE PINE REGIONAL SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL FACILITY:
The territory incorporated into the White Pine regional solid waste disposal
facility is described below:
All lands in the E1/2 SE1/4, SE1/4 NE1/4 of Section 23; SW1/4, S1/2 NW1/4, SW1/
4 NE1/4, W1/2 SE1/4 of Section 24; all in the T.17 N., R.61 E., M.D.B. & M.,
White Pine County, Nevada.
(Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.035: CHANGE OF SITE ALLOWED:
The site of the White Pine regional solid waste disposal facility area shall
embrace all boundaries of White Pine County, Nevada, as set forth in Nevada
Revised Statutes 243.365 et seq. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.040: DESCRIPTION OF WHITE PINE REGIONAL SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL FACILITY
AREA:
The territory incorporated into the White Pine regional solid waste disposal
facility area shall embrace all boundaries of White Pine County, Nevada, as set
forth in Nevada Revised Statutes 243.365 et seq. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.050: GENERAL PROVISIONS:
   A.   All commercial and residential premises, occupied or not, situated in
the White Pine regional solid waste disposal facility area, White Pine County,
Nevada, may be assessed or charged a fee for the disposal of solid waste.
   B.   No person or entity shall deposit or cause to be deposited solid waste
at any location within the White Pine regional solid waste disposal facility
area other than at the White Pine regional solid waste disposal facility. (Ord.
297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.060: REMOVAL AND HAULING OF SOLID WASTE:
All solid waste shall be hauled in such a manner as to prevent any sifting,
spilling, dropping or blowing of solid waste upon any roadway, land or water.
(Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.070: DISPOSAL OF SOLID WASTE:
Any person removing and hauling solid waste shall dispose such solid waste only
at the White Pine regional solid waste disposal facility as designated by the
White Pine County board of county commissioners and further such disposal shall
be made in accordance with all federal, state and local laws. (Ord. 297 §1
(part), 1995)
6.05.080: CONSTRUCTION, MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION:
   A.   Compliance: The construction, maintenance and operation of the White
Pine regional solid waste disposal facility shall comply with all relevant
federal, including, but not limited to, 40 CFR part 258, state and local laws.
   B.   Hours Of Operation: The disposal of solid waste at the White Pine
regional solid waste disposal facility shall be made only during those hours of
operation designated by the White Pine County board of county commissioners.
   C.   Disposal And Access: The disposal of solid waste at the White Pine
regional solid waste disposal facility and access within said facility shall be
at the direction of said facility operator and/or in obedience to instructions
posted by said facility operator. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.090: REMOVAL OF SOLID WASTE FROM RESIDENTIAL AND COMMERCIAL PREMISES:
It shall be the responsibility of the owner of any residential and/or
commercial premises to cause, on a regular basis, the removal of accumulated
solid waste on his/her premises, whether such owner is in possession personally
or through a tenant or otherwise, and whether such solid waste accumulated
during the occupancy of the premises by the owner or by a tenant or while
vacant or otherwise. Nothing in this chapter shall be construed as relieving
from any civil or criminal liability the person actually responsible for any
violation of this chapter. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.110: FAILURE TO REMOVE SOLID WASTE ACCUMULATIONS:
The White Pine County board of county commissioners shall have the power and
authority to issue an order to the responsible party for the removal of solid
waste from any residential and/or commercial premises, the accumulation of
which has become offensive. If the responsible party fails to remove such
accumulation within the time period set forth in the order, the county may
cause the removal of such solid waste in a manner convenient to the county and
further the White Pine County board of county commissioners shall have the
power and authority to charge and collect a reasonable fee for such removal.
(Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.120: NOTICES:
All notices pursuant to this chapter to the owners of residential and/or
commercial premises shall be made in writing and sent registered or certified
mail to the last known address of such owner as it appears on the tax rolls.
(Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.130: ASSESSMENT AND COLLECTION OF FEES:
The White Pine County commissioners may by resolution regularly passed and
adopted carry out the provisions of this chapter and may assess, bill and
collect fees for the disposal and collection of solid waste and the
construction, operation and maintenance of the White Pine regional solid waste
disposal facility. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.140: AMOUNT OF FEES TO BE ASSESSED:
For the collection and disposal of solid waste, the White Pine County board of
county commissioners may by resolution regularly passed and adopted establish
fees for the collection and disposal of solid waste. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.150: COLLECTION AND DISPOSAL OF SOLID WASTE; UNLAWFUL ACTS:
It is unlawful for any person, other than a person to whom a contract has been
awarded or to whom a license has been granted by the White Pine County board of
county commissioners to engage in the collection and disposal of solid waste
for profit. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.160: REMEDIES CUMULATIVE:
Any and all remedies provided in this chapter shall be deemed cumulative. The
county and the officers thereof shall in addition thereto have the right to
exercise and enforce all rights of injunction, the right of abatement of
nuisances, the right of action for damages and the right of prosecution for
violation of any of the provisions of this chapter. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.170: POWER TO REGULATE:
The White Pine County board of county commissioners shall have the power and
authority to make any and all necessary or proper regulations to carry out and
enforce the provisions contained in this chapter, including, but not limited
to, all matters relating to notices, routes of travel and disposal of solid
waste. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.180: EXEMPTION FROM DISPOSING OF WASTE AT WHITE PINE REGIONAL SOLID WASTE
DISPOSAL FACILITY LANDFILL AND PAYING FEE:
An owner of any commercial or residential premises in the White Pine regional
solid waste disposal facility area may be given an exemption by the White Pine
County board of county commissioners from disposing of solid waste at the White
Pine regional solid waste disposal facility and from paying the fees levied in
this chapter upon a showing that such facility is not reasonably accessible to
such premises and that provision for the safe, healthful and acceptable
disposal of such solid waste is available on said premises in accordance with
all applicable federal, state and local laws. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.200: COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER LAWS:
This chapter shall be subject to the provisions of the constitutions of the
United States Of America and of the state of Nevada, all federal, state and
local laws. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.210: STANDARD FOR COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE LAWS:
In the event state or federal regulations governing landfill administration are
modified and made less stringent than those presently in effect, this chapter
shall be modified accordingly. (Ord. 297 §1(part), 1995)
6.05.220: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
Any person who violates the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty
of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction thereof shall be punished pursuant to the
range of punishment set forth in Nevada Revised Statutes 193.150. (Ord. 297 §1
(part), 1995)
CHAPTER 6.08
SEWERS
SECTION:
6.08.010: Cesspools; Outdoor Pit Toilets
6.08.010: CESSPOOLS; OUTDOOR PIT TOILETS:
The maintenance and use of cesspools and outdoor pit toilets, in any portion of
Ely City townsite (East Ely), where sewer lines are now or may hereafter be
installed, is declared to be a nuisance and subject to abatement. Any inhabited
dwelling in any portion of the Ely City townsite (East Ely), where a sewer line
now exists or in which a sewer line may hereafter be constructed, must connect
with such sewer line upon its completion if not already existing. This section
shall apply to the owner of the premises in question, and in the event such
owner be a nonresident, then a notice shall be given to the agent of such owner
or person having charge or control of such premises. (Ord. 5 §1, 1956)
CHAPTER 6.12
GARBAGE DISPOSAL AT WHITE RIVER SANITARY LANDFILL
SECTION:
6.12.010: Definitions
6.12.020: General Provisions
6.12.030: Removal Of Garbage, Trash And Waste Matter
6.12.040: Designation Of White River Sanitary Landfill
6.12.050: Description Of White River Sanitary Landfill Area
6.12.060: Disposal Of Garbage, Trash And Waste Matter
6.12.070: Operation Of Dump
6.12.080: Collection By County
6.12.090: Rates To Be Charged
6.12.100: Failure To Remove Accumulations
6.12.110: Notices
6.12.120: Certain Acts Unlawful
6.12.130: Remedies Cumulative
6.12.140: County Commissioners To Make Regulations
6.12.150: Billing, Penalty For Delinquent Payments
6.12.160: Exemption From Dumping At White River Sanitary Landfill And Fee
6.12.170: Compliance With Other Laws
6.12.180: Violation; Penalty
6.12.010: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this chapter:
GARBAGE: Means and includes kitchen and table refuse, offal, swill and other
accumulation of animals, vegetables and other matter that attends the
preparation and consumption, decay or dealing in, or storage of meats, fish,
fowl, birds, fruits, vegetables, printed matter, paper, boxes, rags, straw,
glass, glassware, ashes, metal, tin containers and grass.
TRASH: Means and includes wood, leaves, dead trees, the branches of trees and
woodenware.
WASTE MATTER: Means and includes natural soil, earth, sand, clay, gravel, loam,
manure, stones, bricks, plaster, cement and crockery.
WHITE RIVER SANITARY LANDFILL: That certain sanitary landfill dumping area set
aside by the board of county commissioners of White Pine County, state of
Nevada, for the disposal of garbage, trash and waste matter, and such other
sanitary landfill dumping area as the board of county commissioners may in the
future designate for the sanitary disposal of garbage, trash and waste matter.
WHITE RIVER SANITARY LANDFILL AREA: That certain area designated by the board
of county commissioners of the county to be served by the White River sanitary
landfill and assessed for the support thereof. (Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.020: GENERAL PROVISIONS:
   A.   All occupants of commercial and residential premises in the White River
sanitary landfill area, White Pine County, Nevada, shall pay the rates for
dumping garbage, trash and waste matter as set forth in this chapter.
   B.   No person shall dump, place or bury on any lot, land, street, alley or
other public place, or in any water or waterway, or ditch, or elsewhere, any
garbage, trash or waste matter.
   C.   Nothing in this chapter contained shall be construed as prohibiting any
person from collecting and removing his own garbage, trash and waste matter;
provided, however, that in so doing, he shall be subject to all requirements of
this chapter as to hauling, place and manner of disposition and all similar
requirements. (Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.030: REMOVAL OF GARBAGE, TRASH AND WASTE MATTER:
All garbage, trash and waste matter shall be hauled and taken to the White
River sanitary landfill in such manner so as to prevent the sifting, spilling,
dropping or blowing thereof upon any of the streets, alleys or public places.
(Ord. 914 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.040: DESIGNATION OF WHITE RIVER SANITARY LANDFILL:
The White River sanitary landfill is that land more particularly described as
follows:
   T. 12 N., R. 61 E.,
   Sec. 35, E1/2 NE1/4 NE1/4;
   Sec. 36, W1/2 NW1/4 NW1/4.
(Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.050: DESCRIPTION OF WHITE RIVER SANITARY LANDFILL AREA:
The territory incorporated into the White River Valley sanitary landfill area
is described below:
   T.13 N., R.60 E., "All"
   T.13 N., R.61 E., "All"
   T.13 N., R.62 E., "All"
T.12 N., R.60 E., "All"
   T.12 N., R.61 E., "All"
   T.12 N., R.62 E., "All"
T.11 N., R.60 E., Only those Sections or portions of Sections which are located
in White Pine County.
   T.11 N., R.61 E., "All"
   T.11 N., R.62 E., "All"
T.10 N., R.61 E., Only those Sections or portions of Sections which are located
in White Pine County.
T.10 N., R.62 E., Only those Sections or portions of Sections which are located
in White Pine County.
(Ord. 281 §1(part), 1993: Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.060: DISPOSAL OF GARBAGE, TRASH AND WASTE MATTER:
Every person hauling garbage, trash and waste matter shall dispose thereof only
at the White River sanitary landfill designated by the board of county
commissioners and such disposition shall be in accord with all provisions of
law, rules and regulations. (Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.070: OPERATION OF DUMP:
   A.   All dumping of any material of any nature or description, be it
garbage, trash or waste matter, shall be in conformity to the following
provisions:
      1.   Dumping shall be performed during, and access to the White River
sanitary landfill limited to, only those hours of operation adopted from time
to time by the board of county commissioners and posted at the main entrance to
the White River sanitary landfill.
      2.   All dumping of any material, of any nature or description, be it
garbage, trash or waste matter, and all access within the dump area shall be at
the direction of the White River sanitary landfill operator or in obedience to
instructions posted by said operator.
      3.   There shall be no burning at the dump except under the direction of
the White River sanitary landfill operator. (Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.080: COLLECTION BY COUNTY:
The county commissioners, by resolution, may carry out the provisions of this
chapter, and may thereunto charge, bill and collect fees for depositing
garbage, trash and waste matter upon the dump as required by this chapter.
(Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.090: RATES TO BE CHARGED:
   A.   An annual charge shall be made and collected pursuant to the fiscal
year by the county from all commercial and residential premises situate and
being in the White Pine River landfill area, White Pine County, Nevada, for the
use of the White River sanitary landfill in the disposition of garbage, trash
and waste matter.
   B.   The rates established in this section shall not be set except by
resolution of county commissioners passed and adopted at a regularly scheduled
meeting. (Ord. 313, 1996: Ord. 281 §1(part), 1993: Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.100: FAILURE TO REMOVE ACCUMULATIONS:
If, at any time, accumulation of garbage, trash and waste matter is not hauled,
or becomes offensive, and is not removed by the owner or persons responsible
for the same, then an order for such removal may forthwith be made by the
county commissioners and if not removed within the time required by such order,
then the county shall have such garbage, trash and waste matter moved in
whatever manner may be convenient and shall be authorized and empowered to
collect the reasonable charges and costs involved and take all lawful steps for
collection thereof. (Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.110: NOTICES:
   A.   Notices to owners under this chapter and under any other provision of
this chapter may be given personally or by registered mail addressed to the
owner at his last known address or address appearing on the tax rolls or
otherwise, general delivery.
   B.   Anything in this chapter to the contrary notwithstanding, the owner
shall be responsible for removal of garbage, trash and waste matter from his
premises and for otherwise complying with the terms of this chapter, whether
such owner is in possession personally or through a tenant or otherwise, and
whether the same accrued during occupancy of the premises by the owner or by a
tenant or while vacant or otherwise. Nothing in this chapter shall be construed
as relieving from any civil or criminal liability the person actually
responsible for any violation of this chapter. (Ord. 194 § 1(part), 1986)
6.12.120: CERTAIN ACTS UNLAWFUL:
It is unlawful for any person, other than a person to whom a contract shall
have been awarded or to whom a license shall have been granted by the county to
collect and remove garbage, trash and waste matter in or from the White River
landfill area, Nevada, and other than to haul his own garbage, trash and waste
matter as provided in this chapter. (Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.130: REMEDIES CUMULATIVE:
Any and all remedies provided in this chapter shall be deemed cumulative. The
county and the officers thereof shall in addition thereto have the right to
exercise and enforce all rights and remedies otherwise created or existing,
including the right of injunction, the right of abatement of nuisances, the
right of action for damages, and the right of prosecution for violation of any
of the provisions of this chapter. (Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.140: COUNTY COMMISSIONERS TO MAKE REGULATIONS:
The county commission is authorized to make any and all necessary or proper
regulations to carry out and enforce the provisions of this chapter, including
all matters as to notices, procedures and routes of travel. Owners hauling
their own garbage, trash and waste matter shall be bound by all such rules and
regulations of which notice may be given as required by the county commission,
and a violation of the requirements of such notices shall be deemed a violation
of this chapter punishable as provided in this chapter. (Ord. 194 §1(part),
1986)
6.12.150: BILLING, PENALTY FOR DELINQUENT PAYMENTS:
   A.   The county treasurer shall maintain a list showing all persons liable
for the charges provided in this chapter, and the treasurer shall issue bills
therefor and shall collect them the same as other county funds.
   B.   If any person fails or neglects, for the period of one month after
billing to make payment of any proper charge against such person in conformity
with the schedule set out in this chapter, the same shall be considered
delinquent and such person shall be liable to the county, by way of penalty for
such failure or neglect, to a further and additional charge equal to ten
percent (10%) of such delinquent charge, and such penalty charge shall be added
to such person's bill, and, unless paid within one month thereafter, shall
continue to accumulate and be added monthly until full payments shall be made.
(Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.160: EXEMPTION FROM DUMPING AT WHITE RIVER SANITARY LANDFILL AND FEE:
An occupant of commercial or residential premises in the White River sanitary
landfill area may be given an exemption by the board of county commissioners
from disposing of garbage, trash and waste at the White River sanitary landfill
and from paying the fees levied in this chapter upon a showing that the White
River sanitary landfill is not reasonably accessible to such premises and that
provision for the safe, healthful and acceptable disposal of such matter is
available on said premises. (Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.170: COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER LAWS:
This chapter shall be subject to the provisions of the constitution and the
laws of the state of Nevada and ordinances enacted by the county commission.
(Ord. 194 §1(part), 1986)
6.12.180: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
Any person who violates the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty
of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction thereof shall be punished by a fine of
not more than three hundred dollars ($300.00) or by imprisonment not to exceed
three (3) months, or by both such fine and imprisonment. (Ord. 194 §1(part),
1986)
CHAPTER 6.16
WHITE PINE COUNTY EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES
(Rep. by Ord. 388, 2004)
wh789   6-20 ()CHAPTER 6.20
LANDFILL USER FEES
SECTION:
6.20.010: Establishment Of Ely Regional Landfill User Fees For County Residents
And Businesses
6.20.020: Billing Entity And Authority
6.20.030: Billing Fee
6.20.040: Enforcement Authorization
6.20.010: ESTABLISHMENT OF ELY REGIONAL LANDFILL USER FEES FOR COUNTY RESIDENTS
AND BUSINESSES:
All residents and businesses located within White Pine County shall be assessed
a user fee for use of the Ely regional landfill as hereinafter set forth on
exhibit A of the ordinance codified in this chapter and adopted by reference.
Special consideration for exemption will be considered by the Ely water, sewer
and landfill board for those residents and businesses who can demonstrate legal
disposal of refuse other than through the Ely regional landfill. Application
for exemption from landfill fees shall be made in writing to the Ely water,
sewer and landfill board. (Ord. 333 §1(1.01), 1998: Ord. 328 (part), 1997)
6.20.020: BILLING ENTITY AND AUTHORITY:
All billing or assessment of the fees set forth herein shall be done through
the city of Ely billing department pursuant to cooperative agreement. The Ely
water, sewer and landfill board shall from time to time, as deemed necessary
and proper for the operation of the Ely regional landfill, review the landfill
fees and increase or decrease the fees by resolution and proper notice to all
rate payers. (Ord. 333 §1(1.02), 1998: Ord. 328 (part), 1997)
6.20.030: BILLING FEE:
In addition to the user fees set forth herein, an additional fee of one dollar
fifty cents ($1.50) shall be assessed each residence and business located
within White Pine County, subject to possible exemption as set forth herein
above. (Ord. 333 §1(1.03), 1998: Ord. 328 (part), 1997)
6.20.040: ENFORCEMENT AUTHORIZATION:
If any section, paragraph, clause or provision of this chapter shall be held to
be invalid, the invalidity of such section, paragraph, clause or provision
shall not affect any of the remaining provisions of this chapter. (Ord. 333 §2
(2.01), 1998: Ord. 328 (part), 1997)
CHAPTER 6.24
PENALTIES
SECTION:
6.24.010: Penalties For Illegal Waste Disposal
6.24.010: PENALTIES FOR ILLEGAL WASTE DISPOSAL:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to dump, spill,
throw, place or bury, or cause the same to be done, any "garbage", "trash" or
"waste matter", as defined by this chapter, on any public or private property,
parcel of land, lot, street, highway, gutter, alley, body of water, stream,
canal or ditch within White Pine County, Nevada, except at an appropriate waste
disposal site operated by or authorized by the county of White Pine or by an
incorporated town within the county.
   B.   It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to dump, spill,
throw, place or bury, or cause the same to be done, any regular accumulation of
garbage, trash or waste matter, in any publicly or privately maintained
garbage, trash or waste receptacle, where such person, firm or corporation
disposes of such garbage, trash or waste matter in public or private waste
receptacles not intended for the disposal of regular or incidental
accumulations of garbage, trash or waste matter.
   C.   When any unlawful deposit of garbage, trash or waste material or sewage
includes any evidence which identifies any person, firm or corporation, such
identification will establish a presumption in any civil action and/or criminal
prosecution under this chapter, that such person, firm or corporation is
civilly and/or criminally responsible for such unlawful deposit and such
person, firm or corporation shall be liable for the cost of removal and final
disposition of the unlawful deposit, in addition to any other penalty
authorized by this chapter or by other applicable law.
   D.   This chapter is not intended to prohibit any person, firm or
corporation from depositing in publicly provided and maintained waste
receptacles, incidental accumulations of garbage, trash or waste material,
associated with periodic motor vehicle traffic; rather, this chapter is
intended to discourage persons, firms or corporations from using waste
receptacles, provided for public use, by public entities, as an alternative to
the deposit of garbage, trash or waste material, in an approved disposal site.
This chapter is intended to prohibit all deposits by any person, firms or
corporations, of any garbage, trash or waste material in any privately owned or
maintained waste receptacle without express authorization by the owner of any
such waste receptacle.
   E.   For purposes of this chapter, "incidental accumulation" of garbage,
waste or trash material, is defined by a volume of no more than thirty (30)
gallons in any thirty (30) day period of time. A "regular accumulation" is
defined as any accumulation exceeding a volume of thirty (30) gallons in any
thirty (30) day period of time.
   F.   If any section, paragraph, clause or provision of this chapter shall be
held to be invalid, the invalidity of such section, paragraph, clause or
provision shall not effect any of the remaining provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 340, 1999)
CHAPTER 6.25
CLEANUP OF TOXIC CONTAMINATION FROM ILLEGAL DRUG MANUFACTURING
SECTION:
Article I. Creation
6.25.010: Created
6.25.020: Purpose
6.25.030: Cumulative Effect
6.25.040: Definitions
6.25.050: Applicability
6.25.060: Rules
6.25.070: Restriction On Transfer Of Property Used As Illegal Drug
Manufacturing Site
6.25.080: Effect Of Transfer Of Property Used For The Manufacture Of Illegal
Drugs
6.25.090: Transfer Allowed After Full Disclosure
6.25.100: Entry Onto Property
6.25.110: Notice That Property Is Unfit For Use
6.25.120: Appeal From Determination That Property Is Not Fit
6.25.130: Notice Of Judicial Determination Of Fitness
6.25.140: Use Of Contaminated Property Constitutes A Public Nuisance
6.25.150: Declaration Of Fitness
6.25.160: Inspection Of Decontamination Efforts
6.25.170: Criminal Penalties
6.25.180: Civil Penalties
Article II. Forms To Be Used Under This Chapter
6.25.190: Notice That Property Is Unfit For Use
6.25.200: Notice Of Judicial Determination Of Fitness
6.25.210: Notice Of Judicial Determination That Property Is Unfit For Use
6.25.220: Declaration Of Fitness
ARTICLE I. CREATION
6.25.010: CREATED:
There is created and added to this code a new chapter relating to the cleanup
of toxic contamination from illegal drug manufacturing. (Ord. 360 §1.0, 1999)
6.25.020: PURPOSE:
It is the purpose of this chapter to provide a just, equitable, and practicable
method, whereby property, which endangers the life, safety or welfare of the
general public or any occupant or occupants of property, because of toxic
chemical contamination, that may result from illegal drug manufacturing, be
required to be decontaminated, vacated and secured against use, or demolished.
This chapter is further intended to promote only permissible uses of property
by property owners. (Ord. 360 §1.1, 1999)
6.25.030: CUMULATIVE EFFECT:
Any remedy or remedies created under this chapter are intended to be cumulative
with and in addition to any other remedy or remedies provided for by state or
federal law. (Ord. 360 §1.2, 1999)
6.25.040: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this chapter, the words and terms used herein shall have the
meanings ascribed to them in those sections wherein reference to any such words
or terms rises, except in instances where the context clearly indicates a
different meaning.
ILLEGAL DRUG: All substances that are produced, prepared, propagated,
compounded, converted or processed, either directly or indirectly by extraction
from substances of natural origin, or independently by means of chemical
synthesis, or by a combination of extraction and chemical synthesis, or are
used for or are the result of any such production, preparation, propagation,
compounding, conversion or process, without authority of the state of Nevada or
the United States government.
ILLEGAL DRUG MANUFACTURING SITE: Any property on which there is a reasonably
clear possibility of contamination with chemicals or precursor chemicals
associated with the manufacture of illegal drugs. The definition shall also
comprehend the keeping, storage, or location of any devises, equipment,
chemicals, compounds, or other articles associated with the manufacture of any
illegal drug upon any property.
MANUFACTURE: Shall have the meaning ascribed to it by Nevada Revised Statutes
453.091 or any subsequent revision thereto by the Nevada state legislature.
PROPERTY: Any:
   A.   Real property, improvements on real property, or portions of the
improvements;
   B.   Airplane, boat, trailer, motor vehicle or manufactured dwelling; and
   C.   Any item or the contents of any item associated with an illegal drug
manufacturing site. (Ord. 360 §1.3, 1999)
6.25.050: APPLICABILITY:
The provisions of this chapter apply to any property that is known to have been
an illegal drug manufacturing site or for which there exist reasonable grounds
to believe that the property has been used as an illegal drug manufacturing
site. This chapter is not intended to apply to property which is the object of
the lawful manufacture of drugs. (Ord. 360 §1.4, 1999)
6.25.060: RULES:
The county health officer shall be authorized to formulate and adopt any rule
associated with the enforcement of this chapter, subject to the consent of the
board of county commissioners for White Pine County. Rules formulated by the
county health officer shall be made and based upon consultation with the Nevada
state fire marshal, the director of poison control for the state of Nevada, any
environmental agency of the state of Nevada or United States government, or any
other agency or entity related to public health whose advise and information is
necessary for the formulation of rules authorized under this chapter. Such
rules adopted under this section shall include a statement of tolerable levels
of exposure to illegal drugs. Rules formulated under this section shall also
include a statement of qualifications for any contractor or other person
responsible for the decontamination of property under this chapter. (Ord. 360
§1.5, 1999)
6.25.070: RESTRICTION ON TRANSFER OF PROPERTY USED AS ILLEGAL DRUG
MANUFACTURING SITE:
Unless a property used for the manufacture of an illegal drug has been
determined fit for use pursuant to section
6.25.150 of this chapter, no person shall transfer, sell, use, or occupy any
property knowing or having reasonable grounds to believe that such was used as
an illegal drug manufacturing site. (Ord. 360 §1.6, 1999)
6.25.080: EFFECT OF TRANSFER OF PROPERTY USED FOR THE MANUFACTURE OF ILLEGAL
DRUGS:
All contracts oral or written, for the transfer, sale, use or rent of property,
in violation of section
6.25.070 of this chapter are voidable at the instance of the purchaser,
transferee, user or renter. This section is not intended to make voidable any
promissory note or other evidence of indebtedness or any mortgage, trust deed,
or other security interest given to a person other than the person
transferring, selling, suing or renting the property to induce such person to
finance the transfer, sale, use or rental of the property. This section shall
not impair obligations or duties required to be performed upon termination of a
contract, as required by the provisions of a contract, including, but not
limited to, payment of damages or return of refundable deposits. (Ord. 360
§1.7, 1999)
6.25.090: TRANSFER ALLOWED AFTER FULL DISCLOSURE:
Any property that has not been determined fit for use pursuant to section
6.25.150 of this chapter may be transferred, sold, or rented if full written
disclosure of the county health officer's determination of unfitness, relating
to the property, has been given to the prospective purchaser or renter. Any
such disclosure shall accompany but not be a part of the sale document nor
shall the same be recorded. However, such property shall otherwise be subject
to all provisions of this chapter regardless of any transfer, sale, or rent
under this section. (Ord. 360 §1.8, 1999)
6.25.100: ENTRY ONTO PROPERTY:
   A.   For purpose of enforcing the provisions of this chapter, the county
health officer, or his designee, shall be authorized to enter upon or otherwise
inspect any property that is known to be or is reasonably suspected to be a
site for the manufacturing of illegal drugs. Any inspection conducted by the
county health officer, or his designee conducted hereunder shall be made upon
the following conditions:
      1.   Any such entry shall be accompanied by presentation of credentials
by the county health officer, or his or her designee, to the property owner, or
any other person bearing rights associated with the property, including, but
not necessarily limited to, actual possession.
      2.   In the absence of consent to enter and inspect the property, which
has been reasonably obtained from the property owner or from any other person
bearing or possessing rights associated with the property, the county health
officer shall procure a warrant authorizing the inspection of the property upon
obtaining a warrant from a neutral or detached judge or magistrate that cause
exists to believe that property exists in White Pine County that has been used
as a site for the manufacturing of illegal drugs and that efforts need be
undertaken by the health officer to safeguard the welfare of citizens in the
county. Such efforts may include seizing the property, evacuation of the
property, removal of contaminants, or any other measure calculated to protect
the public health.
      3.   Any entry made by the county health officer under this section, and
any inspection conducted by him or her thereafter, must be made at a reasonable
time within reasonable limits and by use of reasonable methods.
      4.   This chapter is intended not to provide law enforcement officials
with a right of entry or inspection inconsistent with the provisions of the
Nevada constitution or the United States constitution. (Ord. 360 §1.9, 1999)
6.25.110: NOTICE THAT PROPERTY IS UNFIT FOR USE:
The county health officer, or his or her designee, or any state or federal
public health official, or any law enforcement agency of the state of Nevada or
the United States government may determine that property is not fit for use
under this chapter. Any such determination is effective immediately and renders
the property not fit for use. Any determination that property is not fit for
use under this chapter shall be made in writing, by using a form substantially
similar to that in section
6.25.190 of this chapter. Notice of the determination shall be posted in a
conspicuous place upon the property and shall be provided to the property
owner, if known, or to any other person exercising rights associated with the
property. The county health officer is authorized to require the immediate
evacuation of the property if he reasonably believes that continued exposure to
property will create a risk to the health or well being of any person. The
county health officer, where practicable, may take custody of property and
secure the same in a reasonable fashion, against contact by any person or
persons. (Ord. 360 §1.10, 1999)
6.25.120: APPEAL FROM DETERMINATION THAT PROPERTY IS NOT FIT:
The owner of property which has been determined to be unfit, whether or not the
same has been seized by the county health officer, may appeal the determination
of the agency having made the determination, within thirty (30) days of such
determination. Such appeal shall be made to the justice's court of the township
in which the property is located consistent with the provisions of Nevada
Revised Statutes 4.170 and 4.370. An appeal from the determination by the
justice's court as to fitness for use may be made by the property owner, the
county health officer, or the agency making the determination and must be made
upon compliance with the provisions of Nevada Revised Statutes chapter 189. Any
determination made under this section shall be based upon a standard of clear
and convincing evidence. (Ord. 360 §1.11, 1999)
6.25.130: NOTICE OF JUDICIAL DETERMINATION OF FITNESS:
Any decision made by the justice's court that property is fit for use or unfit
for use shall be provided by a form substantially similar to sections
6.25.200 and
6.25.210 of this chapter. The determination of the court as to fitness of the
property shall be effective immediately and be binding upon the parties. Notice
of the decision by the court shall be provided to any person, business, or
entity having interest in the matter of sale or transfer of the property
including an escrow office or title company. (Ord. 360 §1.12, 1999)
6.25.140: USE OF CONTAMINATED PROPERTY CONSTITUTES A PUBLIC NUISANCE:
The owner of property, which has been deemed unfit for use, who allows the
property to be used for any purpose thereafter, shall be considered to be
maintaining a public nuisance. The district attorney may seek abatement of the
nuisance as provided for by sections 40.140 and 244.360 of the Nevada Revised
Statutes. (Ord. 360 §1.13, 1999)
6.25.150: DECLARATION OF FITNESS:
The owner of any property deemed unfit under this chapter may seek a
declaration hereunder shall be provided to the county health officer or other
agency, having made the determination of unfitness, by a public health officer
or certified laboratory in the state of Nevada. In the absence of reasonable
objection to the declaration given the county health officer or other official,
the property shall be declared fit for use and custody or control of the
property shall be restored to the property owner. A certificate of fitness, in
substantial conformity with section
6.25.220 of this chapter shall be given the property owner. (Ord. 360 §1.14,
1999)
6.25.160: INSPECTION OF DECONTAMINATION EFFORTS:
The county health officer is authorized to perform inspections relating to the
decontamination of any property deemed unfit under this chapter. If the county
health officer, or his or her designee, has cause to believe that any
decontamination efforts by a contractor or other person authorized hereunder to
perform such duty constitutes a threat to public safety, the county health
officer may suspend any such operation with or without notice. Decontamination
efforts thereafter may only be undertaken when the contractor or other person
has corrected any condition deemed hazardous by the county health officer or
his or her designee. (Ord. 360 §1.15, 1999)
6.25.170: CRIMINAL PENALTIES:
It is unlawful for any person to knowingly transfer, sell, rent, use, buy, or
occupy any property that has been used as an illegal drug manufacturing site.
Any person convicted under this section shall be guilty of a misdemeanor. (Ord.
360 §1.16, 1999)
6.25.180: CIVIL PENALTIES:
Any person who uses property as an illegal drug manufacturing site shall be
liable for all costs associated with decontamination of the property including
reasonable attorney costs and fees. In addition to any other liability or
penalty provided for by law, a person using property as an illegal drug
manufacturing site must pay the actual cost of any laboratory analysis to the
county of White Pine. (Ord. 360 §1.17, 1999)
ARTICLE II. FORMS TO BE USED UNDER THIS CHAPTER
6.25.190: NOTICE THAT PROPERTY IS UNFIT FOR USE:
Any notice given under this chapter, that property is unfit for use shall be
made in substantial compliance with the following:
   NOTICE THAT PROPERTY IS UNFIT FOR USE
 
To:                    Property Owner,                      (address), and to
all other persons or citizens of White Pine County, having an interest in the
property.
NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN THAT THE PROPERTY STATED ABOVE IS NOT FIT FOR USE BY ANY
PROPERTY OWNER OR OTHER PERSON HAVING AN INTEREST IN THE PROPERTY. SUCH
PROPERTY HAS BEEN AND IS CONTAMINATED BY REASON OF THE PRESENCE OF CHEMICALS,
COMMONLY USED IN THE MANUFACTURE OF DRUGS. USE OF CONTAMINATED PROPERTY
CONSTITUTES A PUBLIC NUISANCE. THIS NOTICE IS EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY.
DRUGS. USE OF CONTAMINATED PROPERTY CONSTITUTES A PUBLIC NUISANCE. THIS NOTICE
IS EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY.
 
IN ACCORDANCE WITH CHAPTER 6.25 OF THE WHITE PINE COUNTY CODE, THE COUNTY
HEALTH OFFICER IS AUTHORIZED TO REQUIRE THE IMMEDIATE EVACUATION OF THE
PROPERTY IF HE REASONABLY BELIEVES THAT CONTINUED EXPOSURE TO THE PROPERTY WILL
CREATE A RISK OF HEALTH OR WELL BEING OF ANY PERSON. THE COUNTY HEALTH OFFICER
MAY ALSO, WHERE PRACTICABLE, TAKE CUSTODY OF PROPERTY OR SECURE THE SAME IN A
REASONABLE FASHION, AGAINST CONTACT BY ANY PERSON OR PERSONS.
NOTICE IS HEREBY FURTHER GIVEN THAT THE PROPERTY OWNER OR OTHER PERSON HAVING
AN INTEREST IN THE PROPERTY MAY, PURSUANT TO CHAPTER 6.25 OF THE WHITE PINE
COUNTY CODE, APPEAL THE DETERMINATION OF THE OFFICER OR AGENCY THAT DETERMINED
THAT THE PROPERTY WAS UNFIT FOR USE. SUCH APPEAL SHALL BE MADE TO THE JUSTICE'S
COURT OF THE TOWNSHIP IN WHICH THE PROPERTY IS LOCATED. AN APPEAL FROM ANY
DETERMINATION MADE BY THE JUSTICE'S COURT MAY BE MADE TO THE DISTRICT COURT
CONSISTENT WITH THE PROVISIONS OF CHAPTER 189 OF THE NEVADA REVISED STATUTES.
DATED the       day of                          , 2000.
 
                  By:              
                  Agency:              
                               
(Ord. 360 §2.0, 1999)
6.25.200:   NOTICE OF JUDICIAL DETERMINATION OF FITNESS:
Any notice given under this chapter by a court determining the fitness of
property for use shall be made in substantial compliance with the following:
   NOTICE OF JUDICIAL DETERMINATION OF FITNESS
 
To:                   , Property Owner, and other person(s) having an interest
in the property; described as follows:                     (Address or Legal
Description); and,
To:                     , Officer or Agency declaring that the property is
unfit.
YOU AND EACH OF YOU WILL HERE TAKE NOTICE THAT ON THE     DAY OF
                    ,      , A HEARING WAS CONDUCTED IN THE ABOVE-CAPTIONED
MATTER. AS A RESULT OF THE HEARING CONDUCTED, THIS COURT FINDS, BY CLEAR AND
CONVINCING EVIDENCE, THAT THE ABOVE-CAPTIONED PROPERTY IS FIT FOR USE; THAT
CONTAMINATION DOES NOT EXIST ON THE PROPERTY, OR HAS BEEN PROPERLY ABATED; THAT
A SUBSTANTIAL RISK TO THE HEALTH OR WELL-BEING TO ANY PERSON USING OR EXPOSED
TO THE PROPERTY DOES NOT EXIST OR NO LONGER EXISTS.
YOU ARE FURTHER GIVEN NOTICE THAT AN APPEAL FROM THIS DETERMINATION MAY BE MADE
TO THE DISTRICT COURT, WITHIN TEN (10) DAYS OF THE ENTRY OF THIS NOTICE, AS
PROVIDED FOR BY CHAPTER 189 OF THE NEVADA REVISED STATUTES.
DATED this       day of                          , 2000.
                                        
                  JUSTICE OF THE PEACE
(Ord. 360 §2.1, 1999)

unfit for use shall be made in substantial compliance with the following:
   NOTICE OF JUDICIAL DETERMINATION THAT
   PROPERTY IS UNFIT FOR USE

interest in the property; described as follows:

unfit.

MATTER. AS A RESULT OF THE HEARING CONDUCTED, THIS COURT FINDS, BY CLEAR AND

(Ord. 360 §2.2, 1999)
