TITLE 12
RESERVED
TITLE 13
TRAILER PARKS
CHAPTER 13.04
PURPOSE, SCOPE
SECTION:
13.04.010: Designated
13.04.010: DESIGNATED:
This title is designed and created for the purpose of promoting the public
health, safety, morals and general welfare of the present and future
inhabitants of those portions of Ely Township 1, White Pine County, Nevada, for
which master plans of land use and land use (zoning) maps are on file in the
office of the clerk of White Pine County, by providing certain minimum
standards, provisions, requirements and arrangements for sanitation, safety and
use of materials and maintenance for all auto trailer parks or trailer coaches
on private property. (Ord. 14 §1, 1959)
CHAPTER 13.08
DEFINITIONS
SECTION:
13.08.010: Building
13.08.020: Building Code
13.08.030: Business Or Commerce
13.08.040: Cabana
13.08.050: Driveway
13.08.060: Lot
13.08.070: Operation And Maintenance
13.08.080: Person
13.08.090: Ramada
13.08.100: Structure
13.08.110: Temporary
13.08.120: Toilet
13.08.130: Trailer Coach
13.08.140: Trailer Park
13.08.150: Trailer Park Front Boundary Line
13.08.160: Trailer Site Interior Lot Lines
13.08.170: Trailer Site Or Lot
13.08.180: Unfit For Human Habitation Or Occupancy
13.08.010: BUILDING:
"Building" means any structure having a roof supported by columns or walls for
the housing or enclosure of persons, animals or chattels, or property of any
kind. (Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.020: BUILDING CODE:
"Building code" means the adopted building code applicable to the area. (Ord.
14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.030: BUSINESS OR COMMERCE:
"Business" or "commerce" means the purchase, rental, sale or other transaction
involving the handling or disposition of any article, substance or commodity
for profit or livelihood, or the repair or maintenance of any article, or the
sale of personal services and similar enterprises of the same class. (Ord. 14
§2(part), 1959)
13.08.040: CABANA:
"Cabana" means any portable, demountable or permanent cabin, small house, room,
enclosure or other building erected, constructed or placed on any trailer site
within six feet (6') of any trailer coach on the same site in a trailer park.
"Cabana, permanent" means any cabana which is designed so as to not be readily
disassembled, moved or reassembled.
"Cabana, portable or demountable" means any fabricated cabana which is designed
to be readily assembled or disassembled and adopted to ready transportation
from place to place. (Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.050: DRIVEWAY:
"Driveway" is a thoroughfare provided and maintained in a trailer park as the
principal means to access to the abutting trailer sites. (Ord. 14 §2(part),
1959)
13.08.060: LOT:
"Lot" means a parcel of land occupied or to be occupied by any permitted uses,
and including the open spaces required by this title or title 17 of this code.
A lot may be land so recorded on a plat or record or considered as a unit of
property and described by metes and bounds, and may include parts of or a
combination of such lots when adjacent to one another, providing such grounds
are used for one improvement. All lots shall front on or have ingress and
egress by means of an officially approved public right of way or place. (Ord.
14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.070: OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE:
"Operation and maintenance" mean:
   A.   The safe, sanitary and efficient operation of all required devices,
installations, safeguards and sites; and
   B.   The operation and supervision of trailer parks as provided in this
title. (Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.080: PERSON:
"Person" means an individual, firm, copartnership, corporation, estate, trust,
receiver, syndicate, the federal or state government, city, county, district or
any other or combination acting as an entity. (Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.090: RAMADA:
"Ramada" means any roof, or shade structure installed, erected or used above a
trailer coach and site or any portion thereof. (Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.100: STRUCTURE:
"Structure" means the construction or erection of any building, fence, sign,
tower, edifice, or building of any kind, or any piece of work artificially
built up or composed of parts joined together in some definite manner, which
requires location on the ground or attached to something having location on the
ground. (Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.110: TEMPORARY:
"Temporary" means any specified length of time less than twelve (12) months.
(Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.120: TOILET:
"Toilet" includes water closet. (Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.130: TRAILER COACH:
"Trailer coach" means any building, structure, or vehicle equipped with wheels
to facilitate movement from place to place or to travel on the public
thoroughfares, and designed, used and maintained for human habitation. Such
definition includes automobiles or trucks where used for living or sleeping
purposes.
"Dependent trailer coach" means a trailer coach not equipped with a water
closet.
"Independent trailer coach" means a trailer coach equipped with a water closet.
(Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.140: TRAILER PARK:
"Trailer park" means any lot or tract of land used or intended to be used for
the accommodation of three (3) or more auto trailers or trailer coaches. (Ord.
46 §3, 1968: Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.150: TRAILER PARK FRONT BOUNDARY LINE:
"Trailer park front boundary line" means those exterior property lines of an
auto trailer park which have direct access to a public street or thoroughfare.
(Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.160: TRAILER SITE INTERIOR LOT LINES:
"Trailer site interior lot line" means those lines bounding an auto trailer
site on its sides or rear, exclusive of exterior or park boundary lines. (Ord.
14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.170: TRAILER SITE OR LOT:
"Trailer site or lot" means that portion of an auto trailer park or trailer
park subdivision designated, used or designed for the occupancy of not more
than one auto trailer coach and includes that area set aside or used for
automobile parking, carports, storage, cabana, ramada or other structures, and
the yard area as required herein. (Ord. 14 §2(part), 1959)
13.08.180: UNFIT FOR HUMAN HABITATION OR OCCUPANCY:
"Unfit for human habitation or occupancy" means any trailer park, cabana, or
other structure or sanitary facility which is dangerous to human life or
detrimental to health through either lack of maintenance or repair generally,
or because of unsafe or improper construction or installation. (Ord. 14 §2
(part), 1959)
CHAPTER 13.12
PERMITS
SECTION:
13.12.010: Building, Plumbing And Electrical Work
13.12.020: Construction Work; Trailer Occupancy
13.12.030: Improvement Installations
13.12.040: Application Requirements
13.12.010: BUILDING, PLUMBING AND ELECTRICAL WORK:
It is unlawful for any person to do any erection, conversion, alteration,
addition, moving or construction within a trailer park unless a permit has been
applied for and obtained from the county for all building, plumbing and
electrical work in compliance with this or any other applicable ordinance.
(Ord. 14 §3(1), 1959)
13.12.020: CONSTRUCTION WORK; TRAILER OCCUPANCY:
No trailer park owner or operator shall erect, cause to be erected or permit
the erection, construction, reconstruction, relocation, alteration, maintenance
or occupancy of any trailer, cabana, ramada or other structure or addition
within or to a trailer park unless he has first obtained a permit as required
herein. (Ord. 14 §3(2), 1959)
13.12.030: IMPROVEMENT INSTALLATIONS:
Permits shall be required for all concrete curbs, gutters, sidewalks and patios
by White Pine County prior to their installation. The building official shall
inspect each trailer park and the installation and/or construction thereon of
any item required herein by this title for compliance with approved plans.
(Ord. 14 §3(3), 1959)
13.12.040: APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   Applications for permits shall be made to the building office and
accompanied by:
      1.   Two (2) sets of plans and specifications together with complete
mechanical and structural plans of the work to be performed, drawn to a scale
of not less than one-eighth inch (1/8") per foot. Such plans shall show all
trailer sites, roadways, walks, leaching fields, sewer and water lines,
electrical lines, outlets and voltage, buildings, cabanas, ramadas, other
structures and the septic tank location and capacity or the connection to the
public sanitation lines;
      2.   A plot plan of the trailer park drawn to scale showing the actual
shape and dimensions of all trailer sites, accessory buildings, roadways,
signs, cabanas or ramadas with respect to other trailer sites and the exterior
boundary of the trailer park and shall also contain a "north point", legal
description of the property within the trailer park and a general location map;
      3.   The county building official shall be notified by the new owner or
operator of any trailer park of any change of name, ownership or possession
thereof. The notice shall be in written form and shall be furnished within
fifteen (15) days from and after any change in name or transfer of ownership or
possession. (Ord. 14 §3(4), 1959)
CHAPTER 13.16
GENERAL PROVISIONS
SECTION:
13.16.010: Barnyard Animals And Poultry Prohibited
13.16.020: Cabana Rental
13.16.030: Caretaker Required
13.16.040: Certificate Of Use And Occupancy Required
13.16.050: Drainage
13.16.060: Driveways
13.16.070: Electric Lighting
13.16.080: Fences, Walls Or Hedges
13.16.090: Fire Protection
13.16.100: Garbage And Trash
13.16.110: Laundries And Laundry Yards
13.16.120: Maintenance And Operation Responsibility
13.16.130: Parking
13.16.140: Sewers
13.16.150: Signs
13.16.160: Plumbing Fixtures
13.16.170: Trailer Use On Private Property
13.16.180: Storage Of Trailer Coach On Private Property
13.16.190: Unlawful Occupancy
13.16.200: Trailer Used As Living Or Sleeping Quarters
13.16.210: Trailer Used For Business Purposes
13.16.220: Unlawful Sale Of Lots
13.16.230: Water
13.16.240: Location
13.16.250: Sites Without Cabanas
13.16.260: Sites With Cabanas
13.16.270: Inspection, Approval And Certificate Of Use And Occupancy Required
13.16.280: Duties Of Owner Or Operator
13.16.290: Suspension Of Requirements
13.16.010: BARNYARD ANIMALS AND POULTRY PROHIBITED:
No barnyard animals or poultry shall be permitted in any trailer park. (Ord. 14
§4(1), 1959)
13.16.020: CABANA RENTAL:
No structure nor cabana on any trailer site may be occupied unless the site is
tenanted by a trailer and no structure nor cabana may be occupied by any
occupants other than those occupying the trailer tenanting the site. (Ord. 14
§4(2), 1959)
13.16.030: CARETAKER REQUIRED:
It is unlawful for any person to operate or maintain or permit the operation or
maintenance of, any trailer park unless there is a caretaker, owner or manager
in the park. The caretaker shall enforce, within the park, the provisions of
this title governing the operation and maintenance of trailer parks. (Ord. 14
§4(3), 1959)
13.16.040: CERTIFICATE OF USE AND OCCUPANCY REQUIRED:
In no case shall a trailer coach be placed on, nor shall any trailer park be
used or occupied prior to the issuance of a certificate of use and occupancy,
and a final certificate of approval from the proper health authority of the
water and sewerage facilities provided. (Ord. 14 §4(4), 1959)
13.16.050: DRAINAGE:
Every trailer park shall be located and constructed on a well drained area, and
such premises shall be properly graded so as to provide for the drainage of
storm and casual water and to prevent its accumulation. To this end a
topography map and grading plan may be required. (Ord. 14 §4(5), 1959)
13.16.060: DRIVEWAYS:
Every trailer site shall have access to and abut upon a driveway and the
driveway shall have clear and unobstructed access to a public thoroughfare. No
driveway shall be less than twenty four feet (24') in clear and unobstructed
width.
All driveways shall be surfaced with a type of material that will minimize dust
hazards.
A minimum of one 100-watt lamp shall be installed and provided for protective
lighting on each one hundred (100) linear feet on all driveways and these lamps
shall be lighted from sunset to sunrise of the succeeding day. (Ord. 14 §4(6),
1959)
13.16.070: ELECTRIC LIGHTING:
Every public restroom, public bath, laundry room and sink shall be supplied
with lights which may be turned on by the person using such room. (Ord. 14 §4
(7), 1959)
13.16.080: FENCES, WALLS OR HEDGES:
Every trailer park shall be enclosed with a fence, wall or hedge, except that
fences shall not be required on front boundary or front property lines of the
park. (Ord. 14 §4(9), 1959)
13.16.090: FIRE PROTECTION:
In every trailer park or portion thereof there shall be installed and
maintained approved fire hydrants and fire extinguishers of the number, type,
size and location as may be required by the fire department having
jurisdiction. (Ord. 14 §4(10), 1959)
13.16.100: GARBAGE AND TRASH:
In every trailer park an adequate number of metal garbage cans with
tightfitting covers, located in a central area and enclosed from view, shall be
provided and maintained. (Ord. 14 §4(11), 1959)
13.16.110: LAUNDRIES AND LAUNDRY YARDS:
In every trailer park there shall be a laundry compartment constructed and
maintained not farther than five hundred feet (500') from any trailer site.
This laundry shall be supplied with hot and cold water and one double
compartment laundry tray or automatic washer shall be installed for every
thirty five (35) trailer sites or fraction thereof.
In every trailer park there shall be set aside a laundry yard convenient and
adjacent to the above laundry facilities for the occupants of the trailer sites
to dry clothes. There shall be provided adequate and usable line space for each
trailer site within this laundry yard and drying of clothes on lines on trailer
sites shall not be permitted. Such laundry yards shall be enclosed from view
from the trailer park front boundary line. (Ord. 14 §4(12), 1959)
13.16.120: MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION RESPONSIBILITY:
The owner, operator or lessee of the trailer park or his designated agent shall
be responsible for securing the maintenance of all devices, installations and
safeguards required by this title and other applicable ordinances in an
approved safe and sanitary condition and in approved repair and operating
order, and shall also be responsible for securing the maintenance and repairs
of all structures and their sites, and the overall operation of the trailer
park.
No structure shall be so erected, placed or maintained as to obstruct a
required opening in a cabana or awning or a required open space on a site or
prevent inspection of electrical or sanitary facilities or trailer equipment.
(Ord. 14 §4(13), 1959)
13.16.130: PARKING:
   A.   It is unlawful to park a trailer coach overnight upon any public
highway, including the right of way. This provision shall not apply where a
trailer coach is parked for the purpose of making emergency repairs.
   B.   Every trailer park shall provide one off driveway parking space for
each trailer site. (Ord. 14 §4(14), 1959)
13.16.140: SEWERS:
Every trailer park shall be served with an approved sewer system with
connections thereto on every trailer site. The sewer shall comply with this
title and the provisions of the laws or ordinances governing such installation
and as approved by the proper health authority and county plumbing inspector.
Immediately after being placed on a trailer site, every trailer coach shall
have its sink and water closet connected to the sewer by a flexible drain or a
drain approved by the plumbing inspector.
No vent shall be less than two inches (2") in diameter. All vents shall be
located at least ten feet (10') from the adjoining property line of a trailer
park and shall extend at least ten feet (10') above ground level. (Ord. 14 §4
(15), 1959)
13.16.150: SIGNS:
   A.   In every trailer park restrooms shall be distinctly and appropriately
marked "for men" or "for women".
   B.   A building permit for the installation or construction of one outdoor
advertising sign or structure may be issued only if the sign complies with
title 17 of this code or any other applicable ordinances. (Ord. 14 §4(16),
1959)
13.16.160: PLUMBING FIXTURES:
   A.   Every trailer park shall provide properly installed toilet facilities,
properly maintained in good working order and accessible at all times for the
use of the occupants of the trailer park, containing not less than the
following plumbing fixtures:
      1.   For trailer parks which provide facilities for trailers, independent
or dependent, there shall be not less than one water closet and one stall
shower and lavatory for each sex.
Plumbing fixtures shall be connected to the auto trailer court sewer and water
system as specified by the plumbing inspector.
      2.   All toilet facilities for dependent trailers shall be not farther
than two hundred feet (200') from each trailer site. (Ord. 14 §4(17), 1959)
13.16.170: TRAILER USE ON PRIVATE PROPERTY:
Nothing in this title prohibits any owner of a lot or tract of land from
parking his own trailer thereon and living therein if proper sanitary
facilities are provided as required by the health department and provided that
the owner is constructing a single house on the lot for his own use, provided,
however; that this exception shall not exceed the period of one year from the
date of first occupancy. (Ord. 14 §4(18), 1959)
13.16.180: STORAGE OF TRAILER COACH ON PRIVATE PROPERTY:
Nothing in this title shall be deemed to prohibit the storage of only one
"trailer coach" as defined herein on the home premises of its owner, when not
used for living or sleeping purposes, provided that the trailer shall not be
connected with gas, electric or water facilities and not used for any purpose
other than being stored. (Ord. 14 §4(19), 1959)
13.16.190: UNLAWFUL OCCUPANCY:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person in a trailer park to use or cause, or
knowingly permit to be used for occupancy:
      1.   Any trailer coach which is permanently attached with underpinning or
foundation to the ground, except for necessary winterizing precautions;
      2.   Any trailer coach in an unsanitary condition;
      3.   Any trailer coach which is structurally unsound and does not protect
its occupants against the elements;
      4.   Any cabana or ramada on any trailer site untenanted by a trailer
coach. (Ord. 14 §4(20), 1959)
13.16.200: TRAILER USED AS LIVING OR SLEEPING QUARTERS:
No owner, occupant or other person having charge or control of any lot or tract
of land shall allow, suffer or permit any person to place, keep or maintain any
trailer coach for living or sleeping quarters or other purposes, contrary to
this title, on any land, except in an existing trailer park or as specified
herein. (Ord. 14 §4(21), 1959)
13.16.210: TRAILER USED FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES:
It is unlawful to use any trailer for business purposes except in a trailer
park located in a commercial zone. (Ord. 14 §4(22), 1959)
13.16.220: UNLAWFUL SALE OF LOTS:
It is unlawful for any person to sell or offer for sale any lot or parcel of
land for the express purpose of being tenanted by a trailer coach, except as
specified in a duly approved and recorded trailer park as required by this
title and title 17 of this code. (Ord. 14 §4(23), 1959)
13.16.230: WATER:
   A.   Every trailer park shall be served with an approved water distribution
system which shall supply an adequate supply of pure water to every trailer,
with connection thereto on every trailer site for use of the occupants thereof.
The supply system shall be installed so as to comply with the provisions of the
laws or ordinances governing such installation and as approved by the proper
authority, together with the following requirements:
      1.   Not less than two (2) water outlets shall be provided on every
trailer site;
      2.   All such water outlets shall be adapted to hose connections;
      3.   Where water is obtained from wells or other than an approved water
company line, one sample per month shall be submitted to the health department
for bacteriological examination. (Ord. 14 §4(24), 1959)
13.16.240: LOCATION:
Subject to the provisions of this title, trailer parks may be established and
maintained only in the zones designated in title 17 of this code. (Ord. 14 §4
(25), 1959)
13.16.250: SITES WITHOUT CABANAS:
   A.   Any trailer park which is designed, used, operated or maintained which
will not allow the installation, construction or maintenance of cabanas,
ramadas or similar structures shall comply with the following minimum
specifications in addition to those listed in sections
13.16.010 through
13.16.240 of this chapter:
      1.   Trailer Site Area: No trailer site intended to be used or designed
as provided by in sections
13.16.010 through
13.16.240 of this chapter shall contain not less than one thousand two hundred
fifty (1,250) square feet of ground area, and shall be not less than twenty
five feet (25') in minimum width measured at right angles to the side lines
thereof;
      2.   Location Requirements: Trailer location requirements shall be as
follows:
         a.   No trailer coach shall be located closer than ten feet (10') from
any building or other trailer coach,
         b.   No trailer coach or building shall be located closer than five
feet (5') to any rear lot line of a trailer site or an interior property line
of a trailer park,
         c.   Setback lines from front and side property lines in trailer parks
for trailer coaches and buildings shall be in accordance with zoning
provisions; provided, however, if such front or side property line is within
the future width line or right of way of any street shown on the master plan of
streets and highways, then the distance shall be measured from the future
proposed right of way line of the proposed or existing public thoroughfare.
(Ord. 14 §5, 1959)
13.16.260: SITES WITH CABANAS:
   A.   Any trailer park which is designed, used, intended to be used or
maintained that allows the construction, installation or maintenance of trailer
cabanas, ramadas or similar structures on each trailer site shall comply with
all the minimum requirements of this title, except where stipulated in this
section, then these specifications shall be the minimum required:
      1.   Trailer Site Area: No trailer site designed or intended to be used
as provided in this section shall contain less than two thousand (2,000) square
feet of ground area, and shall not be less than forty feet (40') in minimum
width measured at right angles to the side lines thereof;
      2.   Location Of Trailer: No trailer and/or cabana, ramada, building or
other structure shall be located closer to a lot line, driveway or property
line or street, than those distances stipulated in section
13.16.250 of this chapter, for a trailer coach, provided, however, that no
trailer, cabana, ramada or other similar structure shall be located closer than
twenty feet (20') from any other cabana, ramada or trailer on another trailer
site. (Ord. 14 §6, 1959)
13.16.270: INSPECTION, APPROVAL AND CERTIFICATE OF USE AND OCCUPANCY REQUIRED:
No trailer park shall be used for occupancy until and unless a certificate of
use and occupancy has been applied for and received.
No trailer park shall be used or occupied until a final inspection and written
approval is obtained from the health department and a certificate of use and
occupancy has been obtained from the county building inspector. (Ord. 14 §7(1)
(2), 1959)
13.16.280: DUTIES OF OWNER OR OPERATOR:
   A.   The owner, operator or person in charge of any trailer park shall
comply with the following:
      1.   Keep a register of all persons staying in his park, which register
shall be at all times open to inspection by the city, county, state or federal
officers. This register shall record the names and home addresses of all
persons staying in the trailer park, the date of their arrival and departure,
the state and license number of all automobiles and trailers;
      2.   Maintain the park in a clean, orderly and sanitary condition at all
times;
      3.   Require that all trailer coaches and automobiles are located on
their respective trailer sites as required by this title;
      4.   Require all toilets in every trailer coach in the park to be sealed
so that they cannot be used during the entire time it remains on the park
unless every plumbing fixture in the trailer coach is connected to the park
sewer during its entire stay in the trailer park;
      5.   See that all required electric lights are kept lighted as provided
in this title;
      6.   See that garbage is drained and wrapped and deposited in garbage
cans as required by this title or any other ordinance and see that all such
garbage cans are collected, cleaned and redistributed as required by any other
ordinance;
      7.   Not permit any domestic animal in the park, unless the animal is
kept under reasonable control and in compliance with this title. (Ord. 14 §7
(3), 1959)
13.16.290: SUSPENSION OF REQUIREMENTS:
A suspension of any requirement of this title may be granted by the board of
county commissioners in a particular case upon the recommendation of the
regional planning commission. Application for such suspension must show that
there are special circumstances or conditions affecting the property in
question and that suspension will not be materially detrimental to the public
welfare or injurious to property within the area. (Ord. 14 §8, 1959)
CHAPTER 13.20
CABANAS
SECTION:
13.20.010: Location
13.20.020: Protection Against Elements
13.20.030: Designs
13.20.040: Height
13.20.050: Area
13.20.060: Ceiling Height; Permanent Cabana
13.20.070: Dimensions; Portable Cabana
13.20.080: Window Area
13.20.090: Door
13.20.100: Cooking Prohibited
13.20.110: Plans, Copy Of Permit Kept On Site Until Inspection
13.20.120: Wood Framing Studs
13.20.130: Angle Bracing
13.20.140: Floor Joists And Clearance
13.20.150: Concrete Floors
13.20.160: Foundations
13.20.170: Masonry Walls
13.20.010: LOCATION:
Every cabana shall be designed and erected as a free standing structure, and
shall not be permanently attached to or become a permanent part of any trailer
coach. Trailer coaches shall not be a physical part of any cabana. Cabanas may
be attached to a trailer with appropriate flashing or sealing materials to
provide a weather seal. No cabana shall be constructed, placed or maintained on
more than one side of a trailer coach. As used herein, "side" includes "end".
(Ord. 14 §6(3)(a), 1959)
13.20.020: PROTECTION AGAINST ELEMENTS:
Every cabana shall be constructed and maintained as to provide shelter to the
occupants against the elements and to exclude dampness in inclement weather.
The material used in the construction of a cabana shall be of substantial and
approved stock. Every cabana shall have an approved floor of wood, masonry or
concrete. Schedules of weights of materials, safe allowable unit stresses and
formulas for computing stresses shall be of standard recognized practice. (Ord.
14 §6(3)(b), 1959)
13.20.030: DESIGNS:
   A.   Portable Design: Prefabricated portable or demountable cabanas
deviating from standard stud frame construction or designed and constructed of
materials deviating in any manner from standard stud frame construction shall
admit of a rational analysis in accordance with established principles of
mechanics.
   B.   Permanent Design: The construction of permanent cabanas shall adhere to
standard practices and materials of appropriate wood frame or masonry types of
construction. Any design construction not consistent with provisions of this
section may be approved if it can be demonstrated that such deviations are
equivalent to the construction requirements of this title. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(c),
1959)
13.20.040: HEIGHT:
The height of a cabana shall not exceed one story nor thirteen feet (13') at
the highest point above the actual adjoining ground level. No architectural
appurtenances shall extend more than thirty inches (30") above or beyond the
building at any point. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(d), 1959)
13.20.050: AREA:
A cabana shall consist of one room only having a superficial area of not less
than eighty (80) square feet excluding a private toilet or bath compartment. No
cabana shall exceed twelve feet (12') in width and shall be no greater in
length than the trailer coach it serves, except for the private toilet or bath
compartment. No part of such room shall be enclosed or subdivided wholly or in
part by a curtain, fixed or movable partition or other contrivance or device
for any purpose contrary to the provisions of this title. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(e),
1959)
13.20.060: CEILING HEIGHT; PERMANENT CABANA:
A permanent cabana shall have a clear ceiling height of eight feet (8') from
the finished floor to the finished ceiling or if there is no finished ceiling,
to the roof, provided, however, that if the ceiling roof is sloped, the minimum
ceiling height is required in only one-half (1/2) of the sloping ceiling area.
At no point shall the ceiling height be less than seven feet (7') in any
portion of the room. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(f), 1959)
13.20.070: DIMENSIONS; PORTABLE CABANA:
A portable or demountable cabana may have a minimum clear ceiling height of
seven feet six inches (7'6") from the finished floor to the finished ceiling,
or if there is no finished ceiling, to the roof, provided, however, that if the
ceiling or roof is sloped, the minimum ceiling height is required in only one-
half (1/2) of the sloping ceiling area; provided further that the minimum
superficial floor area shall be not less than eighty (80) square feet. At no
point shall the ceiling height be less than six feet six inches (6'6") in any
portion of the room. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(g), 1959)
13.20.080: WINDOW AREA:
Every cabana shall be provided with one or more windows having an aggregate
area of not less than one-fourth (1/4) of the floor area. Windows shall be
arranged so as to properly light all portions of the room; at least one-half
(1/2) of the required window area shall be arranged to open. No required
windows shall be less than six (6) square feet in area. Toilet or bath
compartment windows shall comply with the provisions herein. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(h),
1959)
13.20.090: DOOR:
At least one door opening shall be provided which shall not be less than thirty
inches (30") in width, nor less than six feet two inches (6'2") in height.
(Ord. 14 §6(3)(i), 1959)
13.20.100: COOKING PROHIBITED:
Cabanas shall be used for living purposes only. Cooking within cabanas shall
not be permitted. Cooking appliances, including hot plates, shall not be
installed in cabanas. No portion of such a cabana shall contain kitchen
equipment such as sinks or similar equipment. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(j), 1959)
13.20.110: PLANS, COPY OF PERMIT KEPT ON SITE UNTIL INSPECTION:
An approved set of plans and a copy of the permit shall be kept on the site
until the building inspector has made a final inspection. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(k),
1959)
13.20.120: WOOD FRAMING STUDS:
Wood studs shall be not less than two inches by four inches (2" x 4") spaced
sixteen inches (16") on centers or equivalent to carry wall and roof loads.
(Ord. 14 §6(3)(l), 1959)
13.20.130: ANGLE BRACING:
Each wooden stud wall shall be thoroughly and effectively angle braced at each
corner except that diagonal sheathing or other membrane of comparable strength
and rigidity may be used for angle bracing. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(m), 1959)
13.20.140: FLOOR JOISTS AND CLEARANCE:
If wooden floor joists are used they shall be not less than two inch by six
inch (2" x 6") material spaced at not more than sixteen inches (16") on
centers. Each span of wooden floor joists shall be crossbridged with
crossbridging of not less than two inch by three inch (2" x 3") material at
intervals of not more than eight feet (8') apart. A bearing partition, wall,
girder or other support under the joists that is blocked solid over its top
between the joists and blocked out not less than two inches (2") thick, the
full depth of the joists shall have a clear air space of eighteen inches (18")
measured from the ground beneath up to the bottom of the joists. The area under
the floor shall be kept clean and free of debris and rubbish. The area shall be
enclosed and provided with sufficient screened openings to assure adequate
cross ventilations. The minimum total area of ventilated openings shall be
proportioned on the basis of two (2) square feet for each twenty five (25)
linear feet or major fraction thereof of exterior wall. A wood floor may be
laid directly on moistureproof masonry slabs. (Ord. 14 §6(3)(n), 1959)
13.20.150: CONCRETE FLOORS:
If concrete floors are used they shall have a thickness of not less than three
and one-half inches (31/2"). (Ord. 14 §6(3)(o), 1959)
13.20.160: FOUNDATIONS:
   A.   Every cabana shall be bolted with one-half inch by ten inch (1/2" x
10") bolts at six feet (6') on center or otherwise securely anchored to a
continuous concrete foundation. Sills shall be of foundation grade redwood or
pressure treated lumber of not less than two inches (2") nominal thickness.
   B.   Concrete or masonry foundations and footings for all cabanas shall be
designed to adequately support the weight imposed on them in accordance with
standard engineering practice. Concrete foundations shall be set in undisturbed
soil but in no event less than twelve inches (12") below grade. Footings shall
be not less than sixteen inches (16") wide. Foundation walls shall not be less
than eight inches (8") in width and not less than six inches (6") above grade.
Foundations supporting masonry walls shall be designed accordingly. (Ord. 14 §6
(3)(p), 1959)
13.20.170: MASONRY WALLS:
   A.   Masonry walls shall be:
      1.   Not less than eight inches (8") in width;
      2.   Laid up in cement mortar;
      3.   Reinforced with appropriate steel and tied with properly designed
bond beams;
      4.   So designed and constructed as to withstand vertical live and dead
loads imposed upon them and to withstand a horizontal force from any direction
of fifteen (15) pounds per square foot of wind pressure on a vertical
projection of the exposed surface of the walls;
      5.   Walls described above shall be so designed as to admit of a rational
analysis in accordance with established principles of mechanics. (Ord. 14 §6(3)
(q), 1959)
CHAPTER 13.24
RAMADAS
SECTION:
13.24.010: Construction Requirements
13.24.020: Required Clearances
13.24.030: Attachment, Enclosure Prohibited; Exception
13.24.040: Cooking Or Heating Prohibited; Toilet Facilities
13.24.050: Vents And Ducts Through Roof
13.24.010: CONSTRUCTION REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   A ramada or roof over a trailer or any portion thereof shall be
designed and erected as a freestanding self-supporting structure to:
      1.   Withstand vertical live and dead loads imposed upon it, and to
withstand a vertical uplift or a horizontal force from any direction of fifteen
(15) pounds per square foot wind pressure on a vertical projection of exposed
surface of the structure;
      2.   Be securely bolted or anchored to the ground;
      3.   Be constructed of approved one hour fire resistive materials or of
approved slow burning material. (Ord. 14 §6(4)(part), 1959)
13.24.020: REQUIRED CLEARANCES:
A ramada or any portion thereof shall have a clearance of not less than
eighteen inches (18") in a vertical direction and not less than six inches (6")
in a horizontal direction from a trailer coach. Crossbraces or structural ties
shall not obstruct movement of any trailer coach. The supporting structural
members of a ramada shall not extend more than twelve feet (12') horizontally
beyond either side of a trailer coach nor shall any roof or eave projection
extend more than thirty inches (30") beyond the supporting structural members.
(Ord. 14 §6(4)(part), 1959)
13.24.030: ATTACHMENT, ENCLOSURE PROHIBITED; EXCEPTION:
No portion of a ramada shall be attached to any trailer coach. No side or end
of a ramada shall be enclosed or form a partial enclosure except that the roof
of a ramada may be used as a part of a cabana awning or carport and such
enclosed area conforms to the requirements set forth herein. (Ord. 14 §6(4)
(part), 1959)
13.24.040: COOKING OR HEATING PROHIBITED; TOILET FACILITIES:
Cooking within a ramada shall not be permitted nor shall any cooking or heating
appliances be installed therein. No toilet or bathroom shall be installed or
used within a ramada unless the room is so designed and arranged as to meet all
the provisions of this title. Facilities within a trailer coach are exempt from
the provisions of this section. (Ord. 14 §6(4)(part), 1959)
13.24.050: VENTS AND DUCTS THROUGH ROOF:
All vents and ducts projecting from a trailer coach through the roof of a
ramada shall be of an approved fire resistive slip joint or an approved quick
disconnect type. (Ord. 14 §6(4)(part), 1959)

TITLE 14
BUILDINGS AND CONSTRUCTION
CHAPTER 14.04
BUILDING CODE 1
SECTION:
14.04.010: Adopted
14.04.020: Definitions
14.04.030: Building Official; Office Established
14.04.040: Building Official; Qualifications
14.04.050: Building Official; Duties
14.04.070: Fire Limits Deleted
14.04.080: Permit And Plan Review Fees
14.04.090: Amendments
14.04.110: Nonliability Of County
14.04.120: Board Of Appeals
14.04.130: Violation; Penalty
 
Notes
1 1. NRS 244.105, 278.580, 278.570, 278.610, 244.368.
14.04.010: ADOPTED:
A certain document, at least one (1) copy of which is on file in the office of
the county clerk of White Pine County, being marked and designated as the
International Building Code (IBC), 2018 edition, including all appendices, as
published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the
building code of White Pine County, in the state of Nevada for regulating and
governing the conditions and maintenance of all property, buildings and
structures; by providing the standards for supplied utilities and facilities
and other physical things and conditions essential to ensure that structures
are safe, sanitary and fit for occupation and use; and the condemnation of
buildings and structures unfit for human occupancy and use and the demolition
of such structures as herein provided; providing for the issuance of permits
and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the regulations,
provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said building code on file in
the office of the White Pine County clerk are hereby referred to, adopted, and
made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this chapter, with the additions,
insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in section
14.04.090 of this chapter. (Ord. 527 § 1, 2022: Ord. 419 §1, 2008: Ord. 274 §1,
1992: Ord. 243 §1, 1989: Ord. 205 §1, 1987: Ord. 175 §1, 1984: Ord. 57 §1,
1971: Ord. 15 §1, 1959)
14.04.020: DEFINITIONS:
   A.   Wherever "municipality" is used in the building code, it means White
Pine County.
   B.   Wherever "corporation counsel" is used in the building code, it means
the district attorney of White Pine County. (Ord. 527 § 1, 2022: Ord. 15 §7,
1959)
14.04.030: BUILDING OFFICIAL; OFFICE ESTABLISHED:
   A.   The office of the building official is created and the executive
official in charge shall be known as the building official.
   B.   The building official shall be appointed by the board of county
commissioners of White Pine County by its own motion. His appointment shall
continue during good behavior and satisfactory service. He shall not be removed
from office except on specific charges; provided however, the administrative
and enforcing authority of this code may be delegated by the board of county
commissioners, to a qualified department of another political subdivision, in
which case the person in charge of that department would become the building
official and enforcing officer for White Pine County.
   C.   During temporary absence or disability of the building official the
appointing authority shall designate an acting building official. (Ord. 527 §
1, 2022: Ord. 15 §2, 1959)
14.04.040: BUILDING OFFICIAL; QUALIFICATIONS:
To be eligible to appointment, the candidate for the position shall have had
experience as an architect, structural engineer, building inspector or
superintendent of building construction. He shall be in good health, physically
capable of making the necessary examinations and inspections. He shall not have
any interest, directly or indirectly, in the sale or manufacture of any
material, process or device entering into or used in or in connection with
building construction, alterations, removal, and demolition. (Ord. 527 § 1,
2022: Ord. 15 §3, 1959)
14.04.050: BUILDING OFFICIAL; DUTIES:
   A.   The building official shall devote all necessary time to the duties of
his office. He shall receive applications required by this code, issue permits
and furnish the prescribed certificates. He shall examine premises for which
permits have been issued and shall make necessary inspections to see that the
provisions of law are complied with and that construction is prosecuted safely.
He shall enforce all provisions of the building code. He shall, when requested
by proper authority, or when the public interest so requires, make
investigations in connection with matters referred to in the building code and
render written reports on the same. To enforce compliance with law, to remove
illegal or unsafe conditions, to secure the necessary safeguards during
construction, or to require adequate exit facilities in buildings and
structures, he shall issue such notices or orders as may be necessary.
   B.   Inspections required under the provisions of the building code shall be
made by the building official or his duly appointed assistant. The building
official may accept reports of inspectors of recognized inspection services,
after investigation of their qualifications and reliability. No certificate
called for by any provision of the building code shall be issued on such
reports unless the same are in writing and certified to by a responsible
officer of such service.
   C.   The building official shall keep comprehensive records of applications,
of permits issued, of certificates issued, of inspections made, or reports
rendered, and of notices or orders issued. He shall retain on file copies of
required plans and all documents relating to building work so long as any part
of the building structure to which they relate may be in existence.
   D.   All such records shall be open to public inspection for good and
sufficient reasons at the stated office hours, but shall not be removed from
the office of the building official without his written consent.
   E.   The building official shall make written reports to the board of county
commissioners once each month, or oftener if requested, including statements of
permits and certificates issued, and orders promulgated. (Ord. 527 § 1, 2022:
Ord. 15 §4, 1959)
14.04.070: FIRE LIMITS DELETED:
The fire limits referred to in the code are hereby deleted, excluded and
inapplicable. (Ord. 527 § 1, 2022: Ord. 15 §8, 1959)
14.04.080: PERMIT AND PLAN REVIEW FEES:
No permit as required by the building code shall be issued until the fee
prescribed by the applicable building code shall have been paid.
   A.   The County Building Official(s) shall impose fees for issuing permits
and for plan review. All such fees shall conform to the 1997 Uniform
Administrative Code (UAC).
   B.   Plan review fees and building permit fees will be applied fairly to all
persons seeking permits. Plan review fees must be paid to each entity
performing plan review. (Ord. 527 § 1, 2022: Ord. 419 §3, 2008: Ord. 102 §1,
1980: Ord. 15 §9, 1959)
14.04.090: AMENDMENTS:
The following sections are hereby revised:
Section 101.1. Title. These regulations shall be known as the building code of
White Pine County, hereinafter referred to as "this code".
Section 1612.3. Establishment Of Flood Hazard Areas. To establish flood hazard
areas, the governing body shall adopt a flood hazard map and supporting data.
The flood hazard map shall include, at a minimum, areas of special flood hazard
as identified by the federal emergency management agency in an engineering
report entitled "The Flood Insurance Study For White Pine County", dated
September 18, 1987, as amended or revised with the accompanying flood insurance
rate map (FIRM) and flood boundary and floodway map (FBFM) and related
supporting data along with any revisions thereto. The adopted flood hazard map
and supporting data are hereby adopted by reference and declared to be part of
this section.
Section 1612.3. Establishment of flood hazard areas dated September 18, 1987.
Section 3410.2. Applicability. Structures existing prior to 1957, in which
there is work involving additions, alterations or changes of occupancy shall be
made to conform to the requirements of this section or the provisions of
sections 3403 through 3407. The provisions in sections 3410.2.1 through
3410.2.5 shall apply to existing occupancies that will continue to be, or are
proposed to be, in groups A, B, E, F, M, R, S, and U. These provisions shall
not apply to buildings with occupancies in group H or I.
(Ord. 527 § 1, 2022: Ord. 419 §2, 2008: Ord. 15 §10, 1959)
14.04.110: NONLIABILITY OF COUNTY:
This chapter shall not be construed as imposing upon the county any liability
or responsibility for damages to any person or property caused by any defect in
the workmanship or structure for which a permit has been issued as herein
provided, nor as a result of defective materials used herein. (Ord. 527 § 1,
2022: Ord. 205 §3, 1987: Ord. 175 §3, 1984)
14.04.120: BOARD OF APPEALS:
The board of county commissioners shall act as a board of appeals. A quorum of
the board of county commissioners constitutes a quorum of the board of appeals.
(Ord. 527 § 1, 2022: Ord. 205 §4, 1987)
14.04.130: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
Any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this code hereby adopted
or fail to comply therewith, or who shall build in violation of any detailed
statement of specifications or plans submitted and approved thereunder, or any
certificate or permit issued thereunder, and from which no appeal has been
taken, shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof
shall be punished in accordance with section
1.01.140 of this code. (Ord. 527 § 1, 2022: Ord. 205 §4, 1987)
CHAPTER 14.05

SECTION:

14.05.020: Construction Of Code
14.05.010: ADOPTED:
There is adopted by the board of county commissioners of White Pine County,
Nevada, for the purpose of establishing rules and regulations for the repair,
vacation and demolition of dangerous buildings and structures, including
permits and penalties, that certain code for the abatement of dangerous
buildings known as the uniform code for the abatement of dangerous buildings,
promulgated by the International Conference Of Building Officials, being
particularly the latest and most current edition thereof and the whole thereof,
and official amendments and supplements thereto, and future editions on their
effective dates, save and except such portions as are hereinafter deleted,
modified or amended, of which not less than one (1) copy have been and now are
filed in the office of the clerk of White Pine County, Nevada, and the same are
adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out at length herein, the
provisions thereof shall be controlling in the construction of all buildings
and structures in White Pine County. (Ord. 527 § 1, 2022: Ord. 268 §1, 1991)
14.05.020: CONSTRUCTION OF CODE:
This code is to be construed in conjunction with the International Building
Code (IBC). (Ord. 527 § 1, 2022: Ord. 268 §1, 1991)

SECTION:

14.06.010: ADOPTED:

international residential code (IRC), the 2018, including appendix chapters G,
"Swimming Pools, Spas And Hot Tubs" and H, "Patio Covers," as published by the

equipment, location, removal and demolition of detached one- and two-family
dwellings and multiple single-family dwellings (townhouses) not more than three

providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each

to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this chapter, with

14.06.020 of this chapter. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 418 §1, 2008)

Table R301.2(1). Climatic And Geographic Design Criteria Located In County

CHAPTER 14.08
PLUMBING CODE
SECTION:
14.08.010: Adoption Of Plumbing Code
14.08.020: Administrative Authority
14.08.030: Nonliability Of County
14.08.040: Board Of Appeals
14.08.050: Violations And Penalties
14.08.010: ADOPTION OF PLUMBING CODE:
There is adopted by the board of county commissioners of White Pine County,
Nevada, for the purpose of establishing regulations, for the installation,
alteration and maintenance of plumbing and drainage systems, that certain
plumbing code known as the International Plumbing Code (IPC), being
particularly the 2018 edition thereof and the whole thereof, and official
amendments and supplements thereto, and future editions on their effective
date, save and except such portions as are hereinafter deleted, modified or
amended, of which not less than one (1) copy is now filed in the office of the
County Clerk of White Pine County, Nevada, and the same are adopted and
incorporated as fully as if set out at length herein, and from the effective
date hereof, the provisions thereof shall be controlling in the installation,
alteration, and maintenance of plumbing and drainage systems contained in White
Pine County. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 242 §1, 1989: Ord. 206 §1, 1987: Ord.
176 §1, 1984: Ord. 56 §1, 1971: Ord. 17 §1, 1959)
14.08.020: ADMINISTRATIVE AUTHORITY:
Whenever the term "administrative authority" is used in this code, it shall be
construed to mean the individual appointed by the board of county commissioners
to serve as building official, or the person in charge of the department
delegated by the board of county commissioners as the administrative authority.
(Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 206 §1, 1987: Ord. 176 §1, 1984: Ord. 17 §2, 1959)
14.08.030: NONLIABILITY OF COUNTY:
This chapter shall not be construed as imposing upon the county any liability
or responsibility for damages to any person or property caused by any defect in
the workmanship or structure for which a permit has been issued as herein
provided, nor as a result of defective materials used herein. (Ord. 579 § 1,
2022: Ord. 206 §1, 1987: Ord. 176 §1, 1974: Ord. 17 §2, 1959)
14.08.040: BOARD OF APPEALS:
The board of county commissioners shall act as a board of appeals. A quorum of
the board of county commissioners constitutes a quorum of the board of appeals.
(Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 206 §1, 1987: Ord. 176 §1, 1984: Ord. 17 §2, 1959)
14.08.050: VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES:
Section 114.4 of the International Plumbing Code (IPC) is amended so that the
first sentence of the section reads as follows:
Section 114.4 Violation penalties. Any person, firm or corporation violating
any provision of this code shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon
conviction thereof, shall be punishable by a fine not to exceed one thousand
dollars ($1,000.00), or by imprisonment in the White Pine County jail for a
term not to exceed six (6) months, or by both fine and imprisonment.
(Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 206 §1, 1987: Ord. 176 §1, 1984: Ord. 17 §2, 1959)
CHAPTER 14.12
ELECTRICAL CODE
SECTION:
14.12.010: Enforcement Administration Of National Electrical Code
14.12.020: Adoption Of Uniform Administrative Code
14.12.030: Board Of Appeals
14.12.040: Violations And Penalties
14.12.010: ENFORCEMENT ADMINISTRATION OF NATIONAL ELECTRICAL CODE:
Enforcement of the 2011 edition of the National Electric Code (NEC) in the
county, in effect pursuant to Nevada Revised Statutes 278.583, shall be the
responsibility of the office of the building official of the county. (Ord. 579
§ 1, 2022: Ord. 208 §1, 1987: Ord. 178 §1, 1984)
14.12.020: ADOPTION OF UNIFORM ADMINISTRATIVE CODE:
There is adopted by the board of county commissioners of the county, for the
purpose of administering and enforcing in the county, the technical provisions
of the 2011 edition of the National Electric Code (NEC), that certain uniform
code known as the uniform administrative code promulgated by the International
Conference Of Building Officials, being particularly 2011 and the whole
thereof, and official amendments and supplements thereto, and future editions
on their effective date, save and except such portions as are hereinafter
deleted, modified or amended, of which not less than one (1) copy is now on
file in the office of the county clerk, and the same are adopted and
incorporated as fully as if set out in length herein. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord.
208 §1, 1987: Ord. 178 §1, 1984)
14.12.030: BOARD OF APPEALS:
The board of county commissioners shall act as a board of appeals. A quorum of
the board of county commissioners constitutes a quorum of the board of appeals.
(Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 208 §1, 1987: Ord. 178 §1, 1984)
14.12.040: VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES:
Any person, firm, association or corporation, whether public or private,
violating any provision of the latest edition of the national electrical code
shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be
punishable by a fine not to exceed one thousand dollars ($1,000.00), or by
imprisonment in the county jail for a term not to exceed six (6) months, or by
both fine and imprisonment. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 208 §1, 1987: Ord. 178
§1, 1984)
CHAPTER 14.16
MOVING BUILDINGS
SECTION:
14.16.010: Permit Required
14.16.020: Inspection; Fee
14.16.010: PERMIT REQUIRED:
It is unlawful for any person, firm, association, partnership, or corporation
to move a building in any town having a population of over six hundred (600)
persons, without applying to the board of county commissioners, White Pine
County, Nevada, for a permit to move the building.
A majority of the board of county commissioners may grant or refuse to grant a
permit to move the building, as in their discretion may seem meet and proper.
(Ord. 6 §1, 1956)
14.16.020: INSPECTION; FEE:
The county engineer is to inspect the building to be moved, upon the request of
the board of county commissioners, White Pine County, Nevada. The person
applying for permit to move the building is to pay the county engineer's fee
for inspection of the building to be moved. This fee is not to exceed twenty
five dollars ($25.00) and ten cents ($0.10) per mile traveled. (Ord. 6 §2,
1956)
CHAPTER 14.20
FIRE CODE
SECTION:
14.20.010: Fire Code
14.20.020: Definitions
14.20.030: Storage Of Explosives And Blasting Agents
14.20.040: Storage Of Flammable Or Combustible Liquids
14.20.050: Bulk Plants For Flammable Or Combustible Liquids
14.20.060: Storage Of Liquefied Petroleum Gases
14.20.070: Penalties
14.20.010: FIRE CODE:
The County adopts the State of Nevada's fire code, most recent edition and
official amendments and supplements thereto, as is now and hereafter adopted by
the State Fire Marshal, (currently the International Fire Code (IFC) including,
but limited to Appendix B,C, F and H),(also referred to herein as the State of
Nevada fire code),be and the same is adopted for the purpose of prescribing
regulations governing conditions hazardous to life and property from fire or
explosion in the county of White Pine, state of Nevada; at least one (1) copy
of which is on file in the office of the County Clerk of White Pine County,
providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor;
providing penalties for violation of such code; and the same are made a part
hereof as if fully set out in this chapter, save and except such portions as
are hereinafter deleted, modified or amended. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 286 §1
(part), 1993: Ord. 92 §1(part), 1980)
14.20.020: DEFINITIONS:
For the purposes of this chapter, the words set out in this section shall have
the following meanings:
 
              All references to chief in the adopted State of Nevada fire code, most recent
CHIEF:        edition and official amendments and supplements thereto, currently and
              hereafter adopted by the State Fire Marshal, shall mean the district fire
              protection officer appointed pursuant to ordinance 92 and chapter 473.
              All references to "corporation counsel" in the adopted State of Nevada fire
CORPORATION   code, most recent edition and official amendments and supplements thereto,
COUNSEL:      currently and hereafter adopted by the State Fire Marshal, means the district
              attorney of White Pine County, state of Nevada.
              All references to "jurisdiction" in the adopted State of Nevada fire code,
              most recent edition and official amendments and supplements thereto, currently
JURISDICTION: and hereafter adopted by the State Fire Marshal, means the county of White
              Pine, state of Nevada. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 286 §1(part), 1993: Ord. 92
              §1(part), 1980)
 
14.20.030: STORAGE OF EXPLOSIVES AND BLASTING AGENTS:
The limits referred to in of the State of Nevada fire code, most recent edition
and official amendments and supplements thereto, currently and hereafter
adopted by the State Fire Marshal, in which storage of explosives and blasting
agents is prohibited, and shall not be in principal business districts, closely
built commercial areas or heavily populated areas. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 92
§1(part), 1980)
14.20.040: STORAGE OF FLAMMABLE OR COMBUSTIBLE LIQUIDS:
The limits referred to in of the State of Nevada fire code, most recent edition
and official amendments and supplements thereto, currently and hereafter
adopted by the State Fire Marshal, in which storage of flammable or combustible
liquids in outside aboveground tanks is prohibited, are established as all
mercantile and other congested districts, including, but not limited to,
residential districts of smaller area than those defined in title 17 of this
code. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 92 §1(part), 1980)
14.20.050: BULK PLANTS FOR FLAMMABLE OR COMBUSTIBLE LIQUIDS:
The limits referred to in of the State of Nevada fire code, most recent edition
and official amendments and supplements thereto, currently and hereafter
adopted by the State Fire Marshal, in which new bulk plants for flammable or
combustible liquids are prohibited, are established as being light
manufacturing districts, M-1, as defined in title 17,
chapter 17.64 of this code. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 92 §1(part), 1980)
14.20.060: STORAGE OF LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GASES:
The limits referred to in of the State of Nevada fire code, , most recent
edition and official amendments and supplements thereto, currently and
hereafter adopted by the State Fire Marshal in which bulk storage of liquefied
petroleum gas is restricted, are established as being heavily populated and
congested commercial areas and other areas designated by the Nevada liquefied
petroleum gas board pursuant to the Nevada liquefied petroleum gas act, Nevada
Revised Statutes 590.465 et seq. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 92 §1(part), 1980)
14.20.070: PENALTIES:
Any person who violates any of the provisions of this code hereby adopted or
fails to comply therewith, or who violates or fails to comply with any order
made thereunder, or who builds in violation of any detailed statement of
specifications or plans submitted and approved thereunder, or any certificate
or permit issued thereunder, and from which no appeal has been taken, shall be
deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished in
accordance with White Pine County Code Section 1.01.140. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022:
Ord. 92 §1(part), 1980)
CHAPTER 14.24
STANDARD SPECIFICATIONS FOR PUBLIC WORKS CONSTRUCTION

14.24.005: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this chapter, the following terms are defined in this section:
GENERAL COUNTY ROAD: Other county roads over which there is general county
travel.
MAIN COUNTY ROAD: All county public highways where there is the greatest amount
of general public travel.
MINOR COUNTY ROAD: All other roads or ways which are neither main nor general
county roads but have been established by usage, or were constructed for use by
the public. (Ord. 338 §1, 1999)

CHAPTER 14.28
MECHANICAL CODE
SECTION:
14.28.010: Mechanical Code
14.28.020: Nonliability Of County
14.28.030: Violations And Penalties
14.28.040: Board Of Appeals
14.28.010: MECHANICAL CODE:
There is hereby adopted by the board of county commissioners of White Pine
County, Nevada, for the purpose of providing minimum standards to safeguard the
life or limb, health, property and public welfare by regulation and controlling
the design, construction, installation, quality of materials, location,
operation, and maintenance or use of heating, ventilating, cooling,
refrigeration systems, incinerators and other miscellaneous heat producing
appliances, including permits and penalties, that certain code known as the
International Mechanical Code (IMC) produced by the International Code Council
(ICC), being particularly the 2018 edition thereof and the whole thereof, and
official amendments and supplements thereto, and future editions on their
effective date, save and except for such portions as are hereinafter deleted,
modified or amended, of which not less than one (1) copy now on file, in the
office of the county clerk, and the same is adopted and incorporated as fully
as if set out at length herein, and the provisions thereof shall be controlling
pursuant to the scope of said code within the county of White Pine, state of
Nevada. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 241 §1, 1989: Ord. 207 §1(part), 1987: Ord.
177 §1(part), 1984)
14.28.020: NONLIABILITY OF COUNTY:
This chapter shall not be construed as imposing upon the county any liability
or responsibility for damages to any person or property caused by any defect in
the workmanship or structure for which a permit has been issued as herein
provided, nor as a result of defective materials used herein. (Ord. 579 § 1,
2022: Ord. 207 §1, 1987: Ord. 177 §1, 1984)
14.28.030: VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES:
Section 108.4 of the International Mechanical Code (IMC) is amended to read as
follows:
Section 108.4. Any person, firm or corporation violating any provision of this
code shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof,
shall be punishable by a fine not to exceed one thousand dollars ($1,000.00),
or by imprisonment in the White Pine County jail for a term not to exceed six
(6) months, or by both fine and imprisonment.
(Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 207 §2, 1987: Ord. 177 §2, 1984)
14.28.040: BOARD OF APPEALS:
Section 109.1 of the International Mechanical Code (IMC) reference to the board
of appeals means:
The board of county commissioners shall act as a board of appeals. A quorum of
the board of county commissioners shall constitute a quorum of the board of
appeals.
(Ord. 579 § 1, 2022: Ord. 207 §2, 1987: Ord. 177 §2, 1984)
CHAPTER 14.30
ENERGY CONSERVATION CODE
SECTION:
14.30.010: Adoption By Reference
14.30.020: Substantial Compliance Standard
14.30.030: Nonliability Of County
14.30.040: Violations And Penalties
14.30.050: Board Of Appeals
14.30.060: Effective Date
14.30.010: ADOPTION BY REFERENCE:
The board of county commissioners of White Pine County, Nevada, adopts and
incorporates herein by reference, as its energy code, the 2018 International
Energy Conservation Code as published by the International Code Council in its
entirety excepting any amendments and/or changes as stated in this chapter;
and, the provisions thereof shall be controlling pursuant to the scope of said
code within the county of White Pine, Nevada. At least one (1) copy of this
code is on file in the office of the County Clerk. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022)
14.30.020: SUBSTANTIAL COMPLIANCE STANDARD:
In the enforcement of specific provisions of the adopted technical codes and
standards, the building official or designee is authorized to grant minor
variations from the strict application of specific code and standards
provisions where, in the opinion of the building official, the work is in
substantial compliance with the intent of the adopted codes and standards.
(Ord. 579 § 1, 2022)
14.30.030: NONLIABILITY OF COUNTY:
This chapter shall not be construed as imposing upon the county any liability
or responsibility for damages to any person or property caused by any defect in
the workmanship or structure for which a permit has been issued as herein
provided, nor as a result of defective materials used herein. (Ord. 579 § 1,
2022)
14.30.040: VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES:
Any person, firm or corporation violating any provision of this code shall be
deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be
punishable by a fine not to exceed one thousand dollars ($1,000.00), or by
imprisonment in the White Pine County jail for a term not to exceed six (6)
months, or by both fine and imprisonment. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022)
14.30.050: BOARD OF APPEALS:
The board of county commissioners shall act as a board of appeals. A quorum of
the board of county commissioners shall constitute a quorum of the board of
appeals. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022)
14.30.060: EFFECTIVE DATE:
This chapter shall become effective on June 1, 2022. (Ord. 579 § 1, 2022)

Article II. Appeal Process
14.32.060: Appeal To Board Of County Commissioners
14.32.070: Appeal To District Court
ARTICLE I. REQUIREMENTS FOR CONVERSION OF MANUFACTURED HOUSING TO REAL PROPERTY
14.32.010: CONDITIONS FOR CONVERSION:
   A.   A manufactured home shall not be considered for conversion to real
property unless:
      1.   Location of the home meets all zoning criteria for that property
and/or variances have been obtained.
      2.   Wheels, axles, and trailer tongue have been removed and disposed of
properly.
      3.   Home has a valid Nevada state manufactured housing certificate.
(Ord. 406 §2, 2008)
14.32.020: REQUIREMENTS FOR CONVERSION TO REAL PROPERTY:
A manufactured home shall qualify for conversion to real property if the home
is installed on a concrete or concrete block perimeter foundation in compliance
with the standards for real property conversion published by the Nevada state
manufactured housing division.
   A.   Manufactured Housing To Real Property Conversion Criteria:
      1.   Location of the home meets all the zoning criteria for that property
and/or variances obtained.
      2.   Wheels, axles and trailer tongue have been removed and disposed of
properly.
      3.   Home has a valid Nevada State Manufactured Housing certificate.
   B.   Perimeter Foundations:
      1.   Perimeter Foundation: A perimeter foundation is a perimeter
supporting foundation wall which is constructed of concrete, or concrete block,
on a concrete footing placed below the local established frost depth.
      2.   Manufactured homes must be installed on a perimeter foundation to
qualify as real property for tax and financial purposes. A perimeter foundation
wall and footing shall be constructed of concrete, or concrete block or a
combination thereof as follows:
         a.   Concrete Foundation: A poured in place perimeter concrete
foundation shall comply with the requirements prescribed in the following.
            (1)   Footings: The foundation footings shall be a minimum six
inches (6") thick by twelve inches (12") wide of continuous poured concrete
with two horizontal three-eighths inch diameter (#3) reinforcing bar.
            (2)   Stem Walls: The foundation stem wall shall be a minimum six
inches (6") thick and meeting the locally established frost depth poured
concrete with one horizontal three-eighths inch diameter (#3) reinforcing bar
per eighteen inches (18") in height. Maximum stem wall height shall not exceed
forty-eight inches (48") for over twenty-five percent (25%) of the home unless
the home is installed on a basement wall. All stem walls over thirty-inches
(30") in height shall have vertical three-eights inch diameter (#3) reinforcing
bar, thirty-two inches (32") on center, to tie the footing and wall together.
            (3)   Sill Plate: The stem wall shall have a sill plate of two
inches by four inch (2" x 4") nominal size foundation grade redwood or pressure
treated lumber attached with one-half inch by ten inch (½” x 10") anchor bolts
six feet (6') on center and within twelve inches (12") of each corner and end
of each section of sill material.
         b.   Block Foundation: A concrete block wall foundation shall comply
with the requirements prescribed in the following:
            (1)   Footings: The footings for a concrete block foundation shall
be a minimum six inches (6") thick by twelve inches (12") wide continuous
poured concrete with two horizontal three-eighths inch diameter (#3)
reinforcing bars. Vertical reinforcing bars shall be placed in the footing
within twelve inches (12") of the ends and thirty-two inches (32") on center
and shall extend in height to within two inches (2") of the top of the top
course of blocks.
            (2)   Stem Wall: The stem walls of a block foundation shall be
constructed of eight inch by eight inch by sixteen inch nominal size (8" x 8" x
16") concrete blocks mortared together for a minimum of three (3) rows and a
maximum of six (6) rows. Each cell extending up from the footing shall be
completely filled with mortar. A three-eighths inch diameter (#3) reinforcing
bar shall be placed in the top course to from a bond beam and all cells in the
top course of blocks shall be filled with grout.
            (3)   Still Plate: The stem wall shall have a sill plate of two
inch by four inch (2" x 4") nominal size foundation grade redwood or pressure
treated lumber attached with one-half inch by ten inch (½” x 10") anchor bolts
grouted in the block space a maximum of six feet (6') on center and within
twelve inches (12") of each corner and end of each section of still material.
      3.   Anchoring: All perimeter foundations shall have manufactured and
approved anchoring devices placed in the sidewall footing within two feet (2')
from each corner and spaced eleven feet (11') maximum on center.
      4.   Vents: All foundations shall be vented within three feet (3') of
each corner and provide a minimum of one square foot net ventilation for every
one hundred fifty (150) square feet of floor space.
      5.   Permanent stairs with landing shall be installed for each entrance,
constructed of wood, metal, and/or concrete as approved. The stairs shall meet
the standards required by the appropriate Building Codes.
      6.   House address must be posted on the home or gatepost in accordance
with IBC Fire Code.
      7.   Utilities outside the home, to include water, wastewater,
electrical, propane, etc., must be permanently mounted in accordance with
appropriate Building Codes.
      8.   A building permit is required to obtain a conversion inspection and
approval.
      9.   Home must meet the County's requirements for snow, wind, and
earthquake loads.
NOTE: Foundations For Existing Home: Existing standard set manufactured homes
may be converted to a perimeter foundation set by placing the home onto any one
of the two foundations described above. Other systems that are engineered and
stamped by a Registered Engineer maybe approved. (Ord. 406 §2, 2008)
14.32.030: ALTERNATIVE METHOD:
The installation method for a manufactured home other than concrete or concrete
block may qualify for conversion to real property if the system has been
engineered and stamped by a professional engineer registered in the state of
Nevada. (Ord. 406 §2, 2008)
14.32.040: CERTIFICATE OF REAL PROPERTY CONVERSION:
The county building inspector and/or building official shall certify that the
home meets the standards for real property conversion. (Ord. 406 §2, 2008)
14.32.050: EXISTING HOME:
Existing standard set manufactured homes may be converted to a perimeter
foundation set by placing the home onto any one of the foundations described
above. (Ord. 406 §2, 2008)
ARTICLE II. APPEAL PROCESS
14.32.060: APPEAL TO BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS:
   A.   Any person who is aggrieved by his inability to obtain a certificate of
conversion to real property may appeal the decision of the local building
official or county building inspector to the county commission.
      1.   The appeal must be filed with the county clerk within twenty five
(25) days of the denial of an application to convert a manufactured home to
real property.
      2.   The appeal must be filed on an appeal application form provided by
the White Pine County building department. An appeal fee may be charged.
      3.   Pursuant to section
14.04.120 of this title, the county commissioners act as the appeals board. A
quorum of the county commission constitutes a quorum of the appeals board.
      4.   Action by the appeals board must take place in an open public
meeting under the requirements of the Nevada open meeting law.
      5.   The decision of the appeals board is a final decision for the
purpose of judicial review.
      6.   The governing body shall issue a decision on the appeal no later
than sixty (60) days following the appeal. (Ord. 406 §3, 2008)
14.32.070: APPEAL TO DISTRICT COURT:
Any person who is aggrieved by the decision of the county commission may appeal
that decision to the district court of the proper county by filing a petition
for judicial review within twenty five (25) days after the date of filing of
notice of the decision with the clerk or secretary of the governing body. (Ord.
406 §3, 2008)
CHAPTER 14.34
OFF-SITE MODULAR AND PREFABRICATION CONSTRUCTION CODE
SECTION:
14.34.010: Adoption by Reference
14.34.020: Substantial Compliance Standard
14.34.030: Nonliability of County
14.34.040: Violations and Penalties
14.34.050: Board of Appeals
14.34.060: Effective Date
14.34.010: ADOPTION BY REFERENCE:
The board of county commissioners of White Pine County, Nevada, adopts and
incorporates herein by reference, as its Off-site Modular and Prefabrication
Construction Code, the International Code Council (ICC) and Modular Building
Institute (MBI), ICC/MBI 1200-2021 Standard for off-site construction,
planning, design, fabrication and assembly, as published by the ICC and MBI in
its entirety excepting any amendments and/or changes as stated in this chapter;
and, the provisions thereof shall be controlling pursuant to the scope of said
code within the county of White Pine, Nevada. At least one (1) copy of this
code is on file in the office of the County Clerk. (Ord 579 § 1, 2022)
14.34.020: SUBSTANTIAL COMPLIANCE STANDARD:
In the enforcement of specific provisions of the adopted technical codes and
standards, the building official or designee is authorized to grant minor
variations from the strict application of specific code and standards
provisions where, in the opinion of the building official, the work is in
substantial compliance with the intent of the adopted codes and standards. (Ord
579 § 1, 2022)
14.34.030: NONLIABILITY OF COUNTY:
This chapter shall not be construed as imposing upon the county any liability
or responsibility for damages to any person or property caused by any defect in
the workmanship or structure for which a permit has been issued as herein
provided, nor as a result of defective materials used herein. (Ord 579 § 1,
2022)
14.34.040: VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES:
Any person, firm or corporation violating any provision of this code shall be
deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be
punishable by a fine not to exceed one thousand dollars ($1,000.00), or by
imprisonment in the White Pine County jail for a term not to exceed six (6)
months, or by both fine and imprisonment. (Ord 579 § 1, 2022)
14.34.050: BOARD OF APPEALS:
The board of county commissioners shall act as a board of appeals. A quorum of
the board of county commissioners shall constitute a quorum of the board of
appeals. (Ord 579 § 1, 2022)
14.34.060: EFFECTIVE DATE:
This chapter shall become effective on June 1, 2022. (Ord 579 § 1, 2022)

TITLE

16.04.010: Short Title
