17.08.365: COMPREHENSIVE PLAN:
"Comprehensive plan" means a generalized map, data base policy statement, and
implementation plan adopted by the board of county commissioners, as outlined
in chapter 278 of the Nevada Revised Statutes. (Ord. 203 §32(71), 1987)
17.08.370: CONCRETE MIXING:
"Concrete mixing" means the mixing of hard building material made of cement,
sand, gravel and water. (Ord. 203 §32(72), 1987)
17.08.372: CONDITIONAL USE PERMIT:
A "conditional use permit" is considered special use permit with special terms
and conditions. All special exceptions to allow uses other than those permitted
by right in a zoning designation are referred to as special use permits. (Ord.
447, 2013)
17.08.375: CONDOMINIUM:
"Condominium" means a multi-unit structure in which units are individually
owned, but which does not provide the features of condominium/hotel or hotel
structure. In a condominium, there is outright ownership of a unit or air space
with a divided interest in the common element. (Ord. 203 §32(73), 1987)
17.08.380: CONDOMINIUM/HOTEL:
"Condominium/hotel" means a multi-unit structure in which units may be
individually owned and which provides a centralized management structure
incorporating the following features: a twenty four (24) hour front desk check
in operation, a central phone system to individual rental units, meeting rooms,
food services, and recreational or leisure amenities. (Ord. 203 §32(74), 1987)
17.08.385: CONFERENCE GROUNDS:
"Conference grounds" means a retreat or meeting place used for organized
discussion or consultation. (Ord. 203 §32(75), 1987)
17.08.390: CONFLICT OF INTEREST:
"Conflict of interest" means an indirect or direct personal or financial
interest by a government employee or appointee in an item which is to be
reviewed at public hearing. According to Nevada Revised Statutes 281.481, "No
public officer or employee may use his position in government to secure or
grant unwarranted privileges, preferences, exemptions or advantages for
himself, any member of his household (or) any business entity in which he has a
financial interest". (Ord. 203 §32(76), 1987)
17.08.395: CONSENSUS:
"Consensus" means the general agreement of a group which is not necessarily
arrived at through voting so much as talking something over until everyone
knows which issues are agreed upon, and which are not. Consensus is not binding
on a group; it is not a "decision". (Ord. 203 §32(77), 1987)
17.08.400: CONTIGUOUS:
"Contiguous" means lots, parcels, or lots and parcels that have a common
boundary. "Contiguous" does not include lots, parcels, or lots and parcels
separated by a dedicated road or alley. (Ord. 203 §32(78), 1987)
17.08.405: COTTAGE INDUSTRY:
"Cottage industry" means a processing, assembling, packaging or storage
industry, conducted wholly within an enclosed building located on a site
isolated from other such uses, generating low traffic volume and with little or
no noise, smoke, odor, dust, glare or vibration detectable at any property
line, being generally compatible with surrounding uses or uses permitted in the
districts and being secondary in use to a residential use. (Ord. 203 §32(79),
1987)
17.08.410: COUNTY:
"County" means White Pine County, Nevada. (Ord. 203 §32(80), 1987)
17.08.415: COURT:
"Court" means an open occupied space, other than a yard, on the same lot with a
building or group of buildings. (Ord. 203 §32(81), 1987)
17.08.420: COVENANT:
"Covenant" means an obligation or promise, either express or implied, which may
be binding upon the land, the owner, or both. (See also definition of
"restrictive covenant".) (Ord. 203 §32(82), 1987)
17.08.425: CRITERIA:
"Criteria" means the requirements which must be addressed and met prior to
development of any proposal. When making a decision, it is assumed that
sufficient evidence has been submitted to make a finding that the criteria have
or have not been met. (Ord. 203 §32(83), 1987)
17.08.430: DAYCARE FACILITIES:
"Daycare facilities" means those facilities licensed by the state which provide
daytime care only for the following groups:
   A.   Infant and toddler care;
   B.   Small child care;
   C.   Family group homes;
   D.   School age children's care;
   E.   Senior citizen's care;
   F.   Any similar daycare center or school. (Ord. 203 §32(84), 1987)
17.08.435: DECISION:
"Decision" means a binding agreement established after a review of the issues
and relevant criteria. In the case of a public body, this binding agreement is
established upon a vote of a quorum (as established by ordinance) and shall be
rendered as one of the following as appropriate: approval, approval with
conditions, recommend approval, recommend approval with conditions, denial,
recommend denial, postpone to a specific date, or table for further review or
information. (Ord. 203 §32(85), 1987)
17.08.440: DEDICATION:
"Dedication" means turning over of private land for public use and its
acceptance by the governmental agency using it. Dedication of roads, parks,
school sites, or other uses to serve the public are often conditions for
approval of a development. (Ord. 203 §32(86), 1987)
17.08.445: DELI:
"Deli" means a store that sells ready to eat, and also may provide seating for
consuming food. (Ord. 203 §32(87), 1987)
17.08.450: DENSITY:
"Density" means the amount of dwelling per acre, based on the total area of the
parcel, including vacated rights of way, and excluding noncontiguous lands,
lands designated previously or common open space, and lands used for rights of
way. (Ord. 203 §32(88), 1987)
17.08.455: DETACHED:
"Detached" means not structurally attached to the main structure. (Ord. 203 §32
(89), 1987)
17.08.460: DEVELOPER:
"Developer" means a person or other legal entity who subdivides or partitions
land. (Ord. 203 §32(90), 1987)
17.08.465: DEVELOPMENT:
"Development" means any manmade change to improved or unimproved tracts of
land, including, but not limited to, construction of buildings or other
structures, mining, dredging, filling, grading, paving, excavating, or drilling
operations located within the area. (Ord. 203 §32(91), 1987)
17.08.466: DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT:
A development agreement is an agreement entered into between White Pine County
and a property owner concerning a development project to ensure and promote
public health, safety, morals, and general welfare of the community pursuant to
the provisions of Nevada Revised Statutes 278.020 through 278.0208. (Ord. 453,
2014)
17.08.468: DEVELOPMENT PROJECT:
A development project is considered any development of residential, commercial,
or industrial construction and operation in compliance with this title. (Ord.
453, 2014)
17.08.470: DRIVE-IN:
"Drive-in" means an establishment so developed within a driveway, drive-up or
drive-through facility or parking area that services are supplied in whole or
in part to a customer in a motor vehicle or, in the case of self-service food
or drink, for consumption outside the building, where adequate measures have
been taken in regard to traffic safety. (Ord. 203 §32(92), 1987)
17.08.475: DWELLING:
See definition of "residence". (Ord. 203 §32(93), 1987)
17.08.480: DWELLING GROUP:
See definition of "residence". (Ord. 203 §32(94), 1987)
17.08.485: EASEMENT:
"Easement" means the right of one property owner or member of the public to
make use of the land of another. (Ord. 203 §32(95), 1987)
17.08.488: ENERGY DEVELOPMENT:
Commercial electrical power generation and transmission facilities including
communications rights of way, towers, and associated structures required for
generation of power at that site. (Ord. 454, 2014)
17.08.490: ENGINEER, CITY:
"City engineer" means the engineer or engineering firm formally appointed by
the city council to serve the city of Ely, Nevada. (Ord. 203 §32(96), 1987)
17.08.495: ENGINEER, COUNTY:
"County engineer" means the engineer or engineering firm formally appointed by
the board of county commissioners to serve White Pine County. (Ord. 203 §32
(97), 1987)
17.08.500: ESSENTIAL SERVICE:
"Essential service" means the erection, construction, alteration or maintenance
by a public utility of underground, surface or overhead gas, electrical, steam,
heater transmission or distribution systems, communication, supply or disposal
systems, poles, wires, mains, drains, sewers, pipes, cables, fire alarm boxes,
police call boxes, traffic signals, hydrants, and other similar equipment and
accessories in connection therewith reasonably necessary for the furnishing of
adequate service by such public utilities for the public health, safety or
general welfare, not including buildings, electric substations and transmission
towers. (Ord. 203 §32(98), 1987)
17.08.505: EX PARTE CONTRACT:
"Ex parte contract" means private meetings held with members of a public body,
outside the public hearing, at which there is discussion of an item which will
be heard and a decision rendered at public hearing. Whereas such contract can
destroy the credibility of the hearings process and deprive it of an appearance
of fairness, any ex parte contract with a member of a public body can
disqualify that member from the vote. "Ex parte contract" does not include
discussions with employees of the governing body for the public of
clarification or requests for additional information, but does include
discussions in regard to the merits of the hearing item. (Ord. 203 §32(99),
1987)
17.08.507: FACTORY BUILT HOMES:
"Factory built homes" include mobile homes, manufactured homes, and modular
homes, excluding commercial coaches. The common characteristic of all factory
built homes is that they are entirely or primarily constructed off site and
transported to the residential lot. (Ord. 445, 2012)
17.08.510: FEEDLOT:
"Feedlot" or "livestock feed yard" means a lot or parcel of land improved with
corrals, fences, buildings or improvements, and used primarily for the feeding
and fattening of livestock for subsequent sale, and includes the feeding of
garbage for disposal. (Ord. 203 §32(100), 1987)
17.08.515: FENCE, SIGHT OBSCURING:
"Sight obscuring fence" means a fence constructed in such a way to obstruct
vision. (Ord. 203 §32(101), 1987)
17.08.520: FINDINGS:
"Findings" means a written statement of facts, conclusions and determinations
based on the evidence presented in relation to the hearings criteria and
prepared by the approving authority in support of a decision. (Ord. 203 §32
(102), 1987)
17.08.525: FLAG LOT:
"Flag lot" means a parcel of land created by a subdivision or partition and
which includes a narrow projection or "flagpole" to the public right of way.
(Ord. 203 §32(103), 1987)
17.08.530: FLAGPOLE:
"Flagpole" means a narrow extension of property on a lot from the buildable
area of a lot to the public right of way. (Ord. 203 §32(104), 1987)
17.08.535: FLOOD OR FLOODING:
See section
17.112.050 of this title. (Ord. 408 §2, 2008: Ord. 203 §32(105), 1987)
17.08.540: FLOOD BOUNDARY AND FLOODWAY MAP:
See section
17.112.050 of this title. (Ord. 408 §2, 2008: Ord. 203 §32(106), 1987)
17.08.545: FLOOD HAZARD BOUNDARY MAP:
"Flood hazard boundary map" means an official map of a community issued by the
federal emergency management agency where the boundaries of the flood, mudslide
(i.e., mudflow), and related erosion areas having hazards have been designated
as zone A, M and/or E. (Ord. 203 §32(107), 1987)
17.08.550: FLOOD INSURANCE:
"Flood insurance" means the insurance coverage provided under the federal flood
insurance program. (Ord. 203 §32(108), 1987)
17.08.555: FLOOD INSURANCE RATE MAP (FIRM):
See section
17.112.050 of this title. (Ord. 408 §2, 2008: Ord. 203 §32(109), 1987)
17.08.560: FLOOD INSURANCE STUDY:
See section
17.112.050 of this title. (Ord. 408 §2, 2008: Ord. 203 §32(110), 1987)
17.08.565: FLOODPROOFING:
See section
17.112.050 of this title. (Ord. 408 §2, 2008: Ord. 203 §32(111), 1987)
17.08.570: FLOOD, SHALLOW ZONE:
"Shallow flood zone" means an area where the base flood depths range from one
to three feet (3'), a clearly defined channel does not exist, and the path of
flooding is unpredictable and indeterminate. Such areas are designated AH or AO
on the flood insurance rate map (FIRM). (Ord. 203 §32(112), 1987)
17.08.575: FLOODWAY:
See section
17.112.050 of this title. (Ord. 408 §2, 2008: Ord. 203 §32(113), 1987)
17.08.580: FLOODPLAIN, 100-YEAR:
See section
17.112.050 of this title. (Ord. 408 §2, 2008: Ord. 203 §32(114), 1987)
17.08.585: FLOODWAY FRINGE:
See section
17.112.050 of this title. (Ord. 408 §2, 2008: Ord. 203 §32(115), 1987)
17.08.590: FLOODWAY, REGULATORY:
See section
17.112.050 of this title. (Ord. 408 §2, 2008: Ord. 203 §32(116), 1987)
17.08.595: FLOOR AREA:
"Floor area" means the maximum horizontal area of the building at the finished
floor line, including any storage area. (Ord. 203 §32(117), 1987)
17.08.600: FLOOR AREA RATIO:
"Floor area ratio" means a mathematical expression determined by dividing the
total floor area of a building by the area of the lot on which it is located,
as floor area-lot-area = floor area ratio. (Ord. 203 §32(118), 1987)
17.08.605: FRONTAGE:
"Frontage" means that portion of a parcel of property which abuts a public way,
a dedicated public street, or highway. (Ord. 203 §32(119), 1987)
17.08.610: GOVERNING BODY:
"Governing body" means any group of individuals elected by the general public,
which are given the authority to make final decisions regarding points of
ordinance or law after consideration of community wide (public) interest;
locally, governing bodies may delegate the responsibilities for implementation
of public policies to appointed bodies (for example, planning commission and
hearings councils) and professional staff. (Ord. 203 §32(120), 1987)
17.08.615: GRADE:
"Grade" means the average elevation of the finished ground surface adjacent to
the exterior walls of a building or a base of a structure. (Ord. 203 §32(121),
1987)
17.08.620: GUESTHOUSE:
"Guesthouse" means an accessory residence built with no kitchen facilities, or
a travel trailer, used for temporary use less than four (4) months' living
accommodations, which is restricted to one such structure or trailer in
addition to the main residence per legal lot. (Ord. 203 §32(122), 1987)
17.08.625: HABITABLE FLOOR:
"Habitable floor" means any floor usable for living purposes, which includes
working, sleeping, eating, cooking, recreation, or a combination thereof. A
floor used only for storage purposes is not a "habitable floor". (Ord. 203 §32
(123), 1987)
17.08.630: HARDSHIP:
"Hardship" means a condition under which the strict adherence to the standards
of this title would result in the virtual confiscation of the property in
question; a condition so injurious to bear as to deprive a property owner of
the use of his land. (Ord. 203 §32(124), 1987)
17.08.635: HELIPORT:
"Heliport" means any area used or to be used for the landing or takeoff of
helicopters or other steep gradient aircraft capable of hovering, and shall
include any and all of the area or buildings which are appropriate to
accomplish these functions. (See definition of "airport/heliport".) (Ord. 203
§32(125), 1987)
17.08.640: HISTORIC DISTRICT:
"Historic district" means an area which exhibits the unique historic character
of the area and has been designated as such on the official maps. (Ord. 203 §32
(126), 1987)
17.08.645: HISTORIC LANDMARK:
"Historic landmark" means any historic resource, including its site or a
geographic area, listed on the Nevada state register of historical landmarks.
(Ord. 203 §32(127), 1987)
17.08.650: HISTORIC PRESERVATION:
"Historic preservation" means the act or process of applying measures to
sustain the existing form, integrity, material of a historic building,
structure, or object, and the existing form and vegetation cover of a site. It
may include initial stabilization work, where necessary, as well as ongoing
maintenance of the historic building materials. (Ord. 203 §32(128), 1987)
17.08.655: HISTORIC REHABILITATION:
"Historic rehabilitation" means the act or process of returning a property to a
state of utility through repair or alteration, which makes possible an
efficient, contemporary use, while preserving those portions or features of the
property which are significant to its historical, architectural, and cultural
values. (Ord. 203 §32(129), 1987)
17.08.660: HISTORIC RESOURCES:
"Historic resources" means a district, site, building, structure, object, or
natural feature significant in American history, prehistory, architecture,
archaeology, and culture. It may be of value to the nation as a whole, or
solely to the community in which it is located. (Ord. 203 §32(130), 1987)
17.08.665: HOG RANCH:
"Hog ranch" means any premises where three (3) or more hogs over six (6) months
of age are kept. (Ord. 203 §32(131), 1987)
17.08.670: HOME OCCUPATION:
A "home occupation" means any activity engaged in for profit or business,
conducted on a regular basis throughout the year, that has the characteristics
of a commercial venture (contracts for products and services, advertising,
liability insurance, business permits and licenses), and that is conducted by a
resident as a secondary use of residential property.
   A.   Affected Properties: Those properties that are within three hundred
feet (300') of the boundary of the applicant's property.
   B.   Home Occupation Permit: A one year, renewable permit that allows
limited business activity to be conducted in a residential zone.
   C.   Minor Deviation: Means a use that requires less than a ten percent
(10%) deviation from the required use in the zone and can be permitted without
a public hearing. A "home occupation activity" that is less than a ten percent
(10%) deviation from the land use requirements in residential zones is defined
as an activity that: 1) does not require employees other than family members
who reside on the premises; 2) will not generate traffic, parking, or
deliveries in excess of normal residential use; 3) will not have an
environmental impact on surrounding properties in excess of normal residential
use (noise, dust, fumes, storage of flammable or hazardous materials,
electrical interference); 4) will not require any modification of the dwelling
or accessory buildings that is inconsistent with the residential character of
the neighborhood; 5) a use that does not require visible outside storage of
equipment or materials; and 6) a use that does not require more than twenty
percent (20%) of the square footage of the total building space on the premises
to be devoted solely to the business activity.
   D.   Permitted Use: "Permitted use" means those uses which are allowed to
occur in a zoning district without review at a public hearing.
   E.   Premises: All references to the property in question shall be
"premises" which shall include the dwelling, accessory buildings, and yard
areas, as defined by this title.
   F.   Residential Zones: For the purposes of the home occupation permit,
"residential zones" shall include any zoning designation that allows single-
family dwellings (O-5, open range; R-A, ranch agricultural; and residential
zones R-E, R-1, R-2, R-M, and M-H).
   G.   Special Use Permit: A "special use permit", pursuant to the definitions
and procedures outlined in Nevada Revised Statutes 278.315, allows home
occupation activity that exceeds the definition of a "minor deviation" (10
percent deviation) from the land use requirements of residential zoning
designations. (Ord. 448, 2013)
17.08.675: HORTICULTURE:
"Horticulture" means the cultivation of vegetation. (Ord. 203 §32(133), 1987)
17.08.680: HOSPITAL:
"Hospital" means an establishment catering to persons receiving medical,
obstetrical, or surgical care which provides both eating and sleeping
facilities for patients and provides nursing services on a continual basis.
(Ord. 203 §32(134), 1987)
17.08.685: HOTEL:
"Hotel" means a building which is designed, intended or used for the
accommodation of tourists, transients, and permanent guests for compensation,
and in which no provision is made for cooking in individual rooms or suites of
rooms. Such rooms are not part of an institution in which human beings are
normally housed or detained under legal restraint. (Ord. 203 §32(135), 1987)
17.08.690: INJUNCTION:
"Injunction" means a legal order issued by the court prohibiting a party from
doing a specified act. This may be either a temporary or permanent injunction.
(Ord. 203 §32(136), 1987)
17.08.695: INTERESTED PARTIES:
"Interested parties" means persons or agencies with standing (i.e., having a
proprietary or monetary interest or being within sight or sound of the subject
item) or persons having significant interest in an issue. (Ord. 203 §32(137),
1987)
17.08.700: INTERIOR YARDS:
"Interior yards" means the area within the designated setback. (Ord. 203 §32
(138), 1987)
17.08.705: JUNKYARD:
"Junkyard" means a place where waste, discarded or salvaged materials are
bought, sold, exchanged, based, packed, disassembled or handled, including auto
wrecking yards, house wrecking yards, used lumber yards, and places or yards
for storage of salvaged house wrecking and structural steel materials and
equipment; but not including places where such uses are conducted entirely
within a completely enclosed building, such as pawnshops and establishments for
the sale, purchase or storage of used furniture and household equipment, used
cars in operative condition, or salvaged material incidental to manufacturing
operations. (Ord. 203 §32(139), 1987)
17.08.710: KENNEL:
"Kennel" means a lot or building in which four (4) or more dogs or cats at
least six (6) months of age are kept for the purpose of protecting the animals
from injury, containing the animals, and restricting entrance of animals. (Ord.
203 §32(140), 1987)
17.08.715: KINDERGARTEN:
"Kindergarten" means public or private school or class for children, usually
from four (4) to six (6) years old. (Ord. 203 §32(141), 1987)
17.08.720: KITCHEN:
"Kitchen" means any room and/or portion of a dwelling designed to be used for
the cooking and preparing of foods. (Ord. 203 §32(142), 1987)
17.08.725: LANDING STRIP, PERSONAL USE:
"Personal use landing strip" means an airstrip restricted, except for aircraft
emergencies, to use by the owner of the aircraft based at the landing strip and
by his invited guests. (See also definition of "airport/heliport".) (Ord. 203
§32(143), 1987)
17.08.730: LEGISLATIVE ACTION:
"Legislative action" means an action or decision which is a law making function
rather than a law applying action. (See also definition of "quasi-judicial
action".) (Ord. 203 §32(144), 1987)
17.08.735: LOCAL UTILITIES:
"Local utilities" means the usual electric power, telephone, gas, water, sewer
drainage lines, and those in-line facilities such as gas regulating stations
and water pumping stations. (Ord. 203 §32(145), 1987)
17.08.740: LOT:
"Lot" means a parcel of land used or capable of being used under the
regulations of this title, lawfully created as such in accordance with the
subdivision laws or ordinances in effect at the time of its creation and
suitable for sale, lease, or separate use. (Ord. 203 §32(146), 1987)
17.08.745: LOT AREA:
"Lot area" means the total area contained within the lot lines, measured on a
horizontal plane, and excluding that area used for public ways, roads, streets
and alleys. (Ord. 203 §32(147), 1987)
17.08.750: LOT, CORNER:
"Corner lot" means a lot abutting upon two (2) or more streets at their
intersection, or upon two (2) parts of the same street, such streets or parts
of the same street forming an interior angle of less than one hundred thirty
five degrees (135°) within the lot lines. (Ord. 203 §32(148), 1987)
17.08.755: LOT COVERAGE:
"Lot coverage" means that percentage of the total lot area covered by structure
as defined in this chapter. (Ord. 203 §32(149), 1987)
17.08.760: LOT DEPTH:
"Lot depth" means the horizontal distance between the front and the rear lot
lines. In the case of a corner lot, the depth shall be the length of its
longest front lot line. (Ord. 203 §32(150), 1987)
17.08.765: LOT, INTERIOR:
"Interior lot" means a lot other than a corner lot. (Ord. 203 §32(151), 1987)
17.08.770: LOT, THROUGH:
"Through lot" means an interior lot having a frontage of two (2) streets and/or
highways. (Ord. 203 §32(152), 1987)
17.08.775: LOT LINE:
"Lot line" means the property line bounding a lot or parcel. (Ord. 203 §32
(153), 1987)
17.08.780: LOT LINE, FRONT:
"Front lot line" means the property line separating a lot or parcel from the
street; in the case of a corner lot, the shortest property line along a street;
in the case of a flag lot, the closest line, parallel to the public road, at
the end of the flagpole. (Ord. 203 §32(154), 1987)
17.08.785: LOT LINE, REAR:
"Rear lot line" means a property line which is opposite and more distant from
the front lot line. In the case of an irregular, triangular, or other shaped
lot, a line ten feet (10') in depth within the lot parallel to and at a maximum
distance from the front lot line. (Ord. 203 §32(155), 1987)
17.08.790: LOT LINE, SIDE:
"Side lot line" means any lot other than a front or rear lot line. In the case
of a corner lot, the lot line abutting the side street is termed an exterior
side lot line. All other side lot lines are termed interior side lot lines.
(Ord. 203 §32(156), 1987)
17.08.795: LOT OF RECORD:
"Lot of record" means any platted subdivision lot, partition filed with the
real estate commissioner of the state of Nevada, approved major or minor land
partition parcel, independent ownerships of land, parcels for which valid
building permits have been issued, or lots approved under this title. (Ord. 203
§32(157), 1987)
17.08.800: LOT WIDTH:
"Lot width" means the horizontal distance between the side lot lines ordinarily
measured parallel to the front lot lines. (See also definition of "lot line,
front" for corner lots.) (Ord. 203 §32(158), 1987)
17.08.805: LOT WIDTH, AVERAGE:
"Average lot width" means the result obtained by dividing the total of lot
width measurements taken every twenty feet (20'), beginning with the widest
point, by the number of such measurements. (Ord. 203 §32(159), 1987)
17.08.810: MAINTAIN:
"Maintain" means to cause or allow to continue in existence. When the context
indicates, the words shall mean to preserve and care for a structure,
improvement, condition or area to such an extent that it remains attractive,
safe and presentable and carries out the purpose for which it was installed,
constructed or required. (Ord. 203 §32(160), 1987)
17.08.815: MAJOR ELECTRICAL TRANSMISSION LINE:
"Major electrical transmission line" means any electrical line carrying an
electrical load of sixty six (66) kV and above. (Ord. 203 §32(161), 1987)
17.08.820: METALLURGY:
"Metallurgy" means the reduction or extraction of metals from their ores by
mechanical, physical or chemical methods, including their refinement and
preparation for use as raw materials. (Ord. 203 §32(162), 1987)
17.08.825: MINING ACTIVITIES:
"Mining activities" means the act, process or business of extracting resources
from the ground, but not including the processing of such resources. (Ord. 203
§32(163), 1987)
17.08.830: MOBILE HOME (CONSTRUCTED BEFORE 1976), MANUFACTURED HOME
(CONSTRUCTED AFTER 1976):
"Mobile home (constructed before 1976), manufactured home (constructed after
1976)" means a vehicular structure which is built on a steel chassis or frame,
is designed to be used with or without a permanent foundation, is capable of
being drawn by a motor vehicle and is used as a dwelling. All mobile homes
shall have the respective HUD (housing and urban development) sticker attached.
(Ord. 445, 2012)
17.08.835: MOBILE HOME LOT:
(Rep. by Ord. 445, 2012)
17.08.840: MOBILE HOME PARK:
"Mobile home park" means an area or tract of land where two (2) or more mobile
homes or mobile home lots are rented or held out for rent. "Mobile home park"
does not include those areas or tracts of land, whether within or outside of a
park, where the lots are held out or rented on a nightly basis. (Ord. 203 §32
(166), 1987)
17.08.845: MOBILE HOME SETBACK:
(Rep. by Ord. 445, 2012)
17.08.850: MOBILE HOME SPACE:
"Mobile home space" means a portion of land within a mobile home park used or
intended to be used for parking of one mobile home, including required yards
and parking area, attached or detached accessory building and open space.
   A.   Front line: Narrowest dimension fronting on a street.
   B.   Frontage width: Distance between the side space lines measured at the
front line.
   C.   Depth: Distance between the front and rear space lines measured in the
main direction of the side space line.
   D.   Side line: Space line or lot line which runs perpendicular to or
approximately perpendicular to the front line. (Ord. 203 §32(168), 1987)
17.08.855: MOBILE HOME SUBDIVISION:
"Mobile home subdivision" means a subdivision of land platted in conformance
with the Nevada Revised Statutes and applicable city of Ely ordinances for the
purpose of providing mobile home lots. (Ord. 203 §32(169), 1987)
17.08.860: MODIFICATION TO AN EXISTING PERMIT:
"Modification to an existing permit" means any change in the scope, character
or nature of plans, specifications, etc., of any development which has been
reviewed and approved by a governing body or its representative office. (Ord.
203 §32(170), 1987)
17.08.865: MODULAR HOME:
"Modular home" means a building designed and constructed to be used as a
dwelling, which is either wholly manufactured, or is in substantial part
manufactured, at an off site location to be wholly or partially assembled on
site in accordance with the regulations promulgated by the manufactured housing
division of the department of commerce, pursuant to Nevada Revised Statutes
461.170, but does not include a mobile home. A modular building shall have the
UBC (uniform building code) sticker attached. (Ord. 445, 2012)
17.08.870: MORATORIUM:
"Moratorium" generally refers to and means a temporary freeze on the approval
of all new development proposals or the issuance of building permits pending
certain actions or conditions. In recent years, building moratoriums have been
instituted by water and sewer agencies when sewage treatment facilities are
inadequately providing for public health or when water shortages are
threatened. (Ord. 203 §32(172), 1987)
17.08.875: MOTEL:
"Motel" means a building or group of buildings used for transient residential
purposes containing guestrooms or dwelling units with automobile parking space
provided in connection therewith, which building or group is designed and used
primarily for the accommodation of transient automobile travelers, including
groups designated as auto cabins, motor courts, motor hotels, and similar
designations. (Ord. 203 §32(173), 1987)
17.08.880: MOTOR HOME:
"Motor home" means a self-propelled vehicle providing residential
accommodations. (Ord. 203 §32(174), 1987)
17.08.885: NONCONFORMING LOT, STRUCTURE OR USE:
"Nonconforming lot, structure or use" means a lawful lot, structure or use,
existing at the time this title or any amendment thereto takes effect, which
does not conform to the requirements of this title or its amendments. (Ord. 203
§32(175), 1987)
17.08.890: NUISANCE:
"Nuisance" means any activity on one's land which tends to diminish the ability
of the neighbors to enjoy their lands or rights. A public nuisance is generated
if there is a violation of the zoning ordinance or other law, or if there is a
violation of the public welfare in general. A nuisance per se is an activity
that all reasonable men agree is a nuisance to the community as a whole. (Ord.
203 §32(176), 1987)
17.08.895: NURSING OR CONVALESCENT HOME:
"Nursing home" or "convalescent home" means an establishment providing bed care
or chronic or convalescent care for one or more persons, exclusive of
relatives, who by reason of illness or physical infirmity are unable to
properly care for themselves; excluding, however, institutions for the care of
alcoholics, drug addicts, and persons with mental or communicable diseases.
(Ord. 203 §32(177), 1987)
17.08.900: OFFICIAL MAP:
"Official map" means an ordinance adopted and amended from time to time after
public hearing by the board of county commissioners, containing a map or maps
that show the precise locations of future rights of way and lands to be
acquired by city or county, either through purchase or dedication. Copies of
the official map will be maintained in the regional planning office for public
inspection and will be used to facilitate the proper placement of buildings and
structures in relation to future property lines. (Ord. 203 §32(178), 1987)
17.08.905: OFF STREET:
"Off street" means land which is not within the rights of way of any street or
alley. (Ord. 203 §32(179), 1987)
17.08.908: OPEN RANGE (O-5) ZONING DISTRICT:
The open range classification is intended to encourage commercial and
industrial development of the county's natural resources while accommodating
residential use. Normal ranching and agricultural practices shall not be
considered a nuisance condition. Nothing herein is intended to interfere with
normal ranching or agricultural practices that might result in conditions such
as noise, dust, or odor. Mineral exploration and extraction shall also be
permitted in this zone. (Ord. 454, 2014)
17.08.910: OVERLAY ZONE:
"Overlay zone" means a supplementary zone addressing the unique or special
circumstances on the use of land beyond those normally applied to the zone
(e.g., flooding, slopes, historic character). (Ord. 203 §32(180), 1987)
17.08.915: PARCEL:
"Parcel" means a tract of land created by a partition or a lot of record. (Ord.
203 §32(181), 1987)
17.08.920: PARKING AREA:
"Parking area" means an area containing parking spaces. (Ord. 203 §32(182),
1987)
17.08.925: PARKING LOT:
"Parking lot" means an area other than a single-family dwelling used for the
off street parking of more than two (2) motor vehicles, including parking
spaces, access and maneuvering aisles. (Ord. 203 §32(183), 1987)
17.08.930: PARKING SPACE:
"Parking space" means an area permanently reserved for the temporary storage of
any motor vehicle and connected with a street or driveway suitable for such
vehicles, situated entirely outside the right of way of any public street or
alley. (Ord. 203 §32(184), 1987)
17.08.935: PERMITTEE:
"Permittee" means the person who is proposing to use or who is using the land
pursuant to any permit required in this title. (Ord. 203 §32(185), 1987)
17.08.940: PERSON:
"Person" means every natural person, firm, partnership, association, social or
fraternal organization, corporation, estate, trust, receiver, syndicate, branch
of government, or any other group or combination acting as a unit. (Ord. 203
§32(186), 1987)
17.08.945: PETS:
"Pets" means:
   A.   Dogs;
   B.   Common household cats, excluding large or exotic varieties normally
located in the wild or displayed by zoological societies;
   C.   Birds, including poultry, and other small animals, when contained and
housed within a residential structure and not present in sufficient numbers as
to constitute a nuisance to neighbors or to constitute a business. (Ord. 203
§32(187), 1987)
17.08.950: PLANNING DIRECTOR:
"Planning director" means the director of planning for the White Pine County
regional planning commission, or his authorized representative. (Ord. 203 §32
(188), 1987)
17.08.955: PLANNED UNIT DEVELOPMENT (PUD):
"Planned unit development (PUD)" means a development of residential,
commercial, industrial, and/or semipublic units grouped in a fashion which
provides for variety and diversification of design features while maintaining
density requirements. Planned unit developments should each be planned as an
entity with options for such uses as grouping dwelling units, allowing an area
for open space, mixing housing types (including mobile homes) and land uses,
and should be designed to preserve or enhance natural features. (Ord. 203 §32
(189), 1987)
17.08.960: PORNOGRAPHY:
"Pornography" means writing or pictures or films, etc., that are intended to
stimulate erotic feelings by description or portrayal of sexual activities.
(Ord. 203 §32(190), 1987)
17.08.965: PRIVATE GARAGE:
"Private garage" means an enclosed accessory building, attached or detached,
used for storage of motor vehicles used by occupants of the principal building
and providing no public shop or services in connection therewith. (Ord. 203 §32
(191), 1987)
17.08.970: PROFESSIONAL OFFICE:
"Professional office" means the place of business of a person engaged in a
recognized profession. (Ord. 203 §32(192), 1987)
17.08.975: PROFESSION, RECOGNIZED:
"Recognized profession" means a vocation, calling, occupation, or employment
involving labor skills, education, special knowledge and compensation for
profit, where the labor and skill involved is predominately mental or
intellectual rather than physical or manual. (Ord. 203 §32(193), 1987)
17.08.977: PROPER AND ACCEPTED AGRICULTURAL CUSTOMS AND STANDARDS:
"Proper and accepted agricultural customs and standards" shall be considered
compliance with all applicable state and federal statutes and regulations
governing the operation of the agricultural processing activity, operation,
facility, or appurtenances thereof. (Ord. 454, 2014)
17.08.978: PROPERTY OWNER:
For the purposes of chapter 17.116 of this title, the term "property owner"
shall mean any individual, corporation, quasi-public, or public entity with
legal title to land as recorded with the White Pine County recorder's office
including rights to use federally administered land conveyed by an agency of
the United States government. (Ord. 453, 2014)
17.08.980: PUBLIC BODY:
"Public body" means any administrative, advisory, executive or legislative body
of the state or a local government which expends or disburses, or is supported,
in whole or in part, by tax revenue, including, but not limited to, any board,
commission, committee, subcommittee or other subsidiary thereof. (Ord. 203 §32
(194), 1987)
17.08.985: PUBLIC BUILDING:
"Public building" means relating to people as a whole, or a building that is
used open to the entire community. (Ord. 203 §32(195), 1987)
17.08.990: PUBLIC HEARING:
"Public hearing" means a meeting of members of a public body, at which a quorum
is present, and where there is an opportunity for all interested parties to be
heard (i.e., to offer their views and to supply evidence in support of this
view), and at which decisions are made on any matter over which the public body
has jurisdiction or advisory power. (Ord. 203 §32(196), 1987)
17.08.995: PUBLIC HEARING, DE NOVO:
"De novo public hearing" means a complete new hearing, including presentation
of testimony and evidence and review of the criteria. (Ord. 203 §32(197), 1987)
17.08.1000: PUBLIC HEARING, ON THE RECORD:
"On the record public hearing" means a public hearing at which no new testimony
or evidence is presented and decision making is based on the public records,
testimony and evidence of a previous public hearing. (Ord. 203 §32(198), 1987)
17.08.1005: PUBLIC UTILITIES:
"Public utilities" shall be defined as any activity identified as a public
utility in Nevada Revised Statutes 704.020 and 704.021. (Ord. 454, 2014)
17.08.1010: QUASI-JUDICIAL:
"Quasi-judicial" means as if, or almost as if, it were judicial. A type of
activity where general laws or policies are applicable to specific property,
according to certain preestablished procedures and in accordance with certain
objective standards and criteria. (See also definition of "legislative
action".) (Ord. 203 §32(200), 1987)
17.08.1012: RANCH AGRICULTURAL (R-A) ZONING DISTRICTS:
The ranch agricultural classification is intended to provide areas for large
lot residential development on one, 2.5, five plus (5+), and ten plus (10+)
acre parcels within five (5) miles of the corporate boundaries of existing
townships and incorporated cities. Primary use of ranch agricultural zoning
designations for one, two and a half (21/2), and five (5) acre parcels is
single-family dwellings. Residential use may include small, hobby farming for
personal use and limited commercial use as appropriate for the size of the
property, which is conducted in a manner consistent with proper and accepted
agricultural customs and standards and which does not detract from the
residential quality of the neighborhood by generating noise, dust, or odor that
is not consistent with standard agricultural practices. Use of ranch
agricultural parcels of five (5) or more acres and ten (10) or more acres may
include large scale commercial agricultural activity. (Ord. 454, 2014)
17.08.1015: RECREATIONAL DEVELOPMENT, INTENSIVE USE:
"Intensive use recreational development" means the development of structures or
areas for human enjoyment, refreshment, interaction, diversion or amenity,
where such structure exceeds eight hundred (800) square feet of floor area or
where vehicular traffic is generated in excess of approximately one hundred
(100) trips per acre per day. This may include, but shall not be limited to,
such uses as bars, lodges, amusement centers, restaurants, social clubs or
community centers, unless otherwise restricted by ordinance. (Ord. 203 §32
(201), 1987)
17.08.1020: RECREATIONAL DEVELOPMENT, LOW INTENSITY USE:
"Low intensity recreational use" means the development of structures or areas
for human enjoyment, refreshment, interaction, diversion or amenity, where such
structures have less than eight hundred (800) square feet of floor area or
where vehicular traffic is generally generated in an amount less than one
hundred (100) trips per acre per day. This may include, but shall not be
limited to, such uses as parks, fishing, boating, equestrian activities, golf
courses, playgrounds, unless otherwise restricted by ordinance. (Ord. 203 §32
(202), 1987)
17.08.1025: RECREATIONAL VEHICLE:
"Recreational vehicle" means a vacation trailer, camping vehicle, or other unit
with or without motive power, less than ten feet (10') wide and not more than
forty five feet (45') long, which is designed for temporary human occupancy,
for recreational travel, camping or emergency purposes, and has a floor space
of less than two hundred twenty (220) square feet, excluding built in equipment
such as wardrobes, closets, cabinets, kitchen units or fixtures, and bath or
toilet rooms. The unit shall be identified as a recreational vehicle by the
manufacturer. (See also definition of "travel trailer".) (Ord. 203 §32(203),
1987)
17.08.1030: RECREATIONAL VEHICLE PARK:
See definition of "travel trailer park". (Ord. 203 §32(204), 1987)
17.08.1032: RENEWABLE ENERGY:
"Renewable energy" means a source of energy that occurs naturally or is
regenerated naturally, including, without limitation: biomass; fuel cells;
geothermal energy; solar energy; water power; and wind. The term does not
include coal, natural gas, oil, propane or any other fossil fuel, or nuclear
energy. (Ord. 452, 2014)
17.08.1033: RENEWABLE ENERGY GENERATION PROJECT:
"Renewable energy generation project" means a project involving an electric
generating facility or system having a nameplate capacity equal to or over ten
(10) MW that uses renewable energy as its primary source of energy to generate
electricity. The term does not include a project involving an electric
generating facility or system that uses nuclear energy, in whole or in part, to
generate electricity. (Ord. 452, 2014)
17.08.1035: RESIDENCE:
"Residence" means a place for permanent human habitation which falls into one
of the following categories:
   A.   Dwelling, Single-Family: A building designed or used for residential
purposes by not more than one family and containing one dwelling unit. A mobile
home shall be considered a single-family dwelling.
   B.   Dwelling, Two-Family: See Duplex.
   C.   Duplex: A building containing two (2) dwelling units; also known as a
two-family dwelling.
   D.   Dwelling Group: A group of three (3) or more dwellings, located on a
parcel of land, in one ownership, and having any yard or court in common.
   E.   Dwelling, Multi-Family: A building containing three (3) or more
dwelling units.
   F.   Dwelling Unit: One or more rooms designed for occupancy by one family.
   G.   Condominium: A multi-unit structure in which units are individually
owned, but which does not provide the features of a condominium/hotel or hotel
structure. In a condominium, there is outright ownership of a unit or airspace
with a divided interest in the common element.
   H.   Row Houses: Multi-family or condominium residences which share common
walls, and the entrances to each is from the ground floor, i.e., there are no
units located totally above or below another unit. (Ord. 203 §32(205), 1987)
17.08.1040: RESTAURANT:
"Restaurant" means any establishment where food and drink is prepared for sale
to the public. (Ord. 203 §32(206), 1987)
17.08.1045: RESTRICTIVE COVENANT:
"Restrictive covenant" means a promise or condition contained in a deed or
other recorded instrument imposing a limitation on the use of property. (Ord.
203 §32(207), 1987)
17.08.1050: RETAIL USE:
"Retail use" means a commercial establishment selling goods at retail; however,
a home occupation shall not be considered as a retail use. (Ord. 203 §32(208),
1987)
17.08.1055: RIPARIAN VEGETATION:
"Riparian vegetation" means vegetation found on or near the banks of a river or
other body of water. (Ord. 203 §32(209), 1987)
17.08.1060: ROADS:
The following definitions apply to roads:
   A.   Road: The terms "road", "street", or "highway" mean and include the
entire area between the right of way lines of any public road, or the entire
width of a private road easement created to provide ingress or egress to land,
including a private way that is created to provide ingress egress to land,
including a private way that is created to provide ingress or egress to land in
conjunction with the use of such land for forestry, mining, or agricultural
purposes. Roads may be classified by their expected level of service and
function.
   B.   Road Level Of Service And Ownership:
      1.   City Or County Road: A road which has become part of the city or
county road system through dedication, has been given a city or county road
name or number, and has a description on file in the office of the department
of transportation. Such a road may or may not be maintained by the governing
body.
      2.   Dedicated Way: A road dedicated to the public for road purposes,
shown on a map or plat approved by the city or county and recorded in the
records of either.
      3.   Dedicated Way, Maintained: A road which has been dedicated and is
maintained by the governing body.
      4.   Private Road: A private road is created to provide ingress or egress
to one to three (3) lots, parcels, areas, or tracts of land, and which has been
approved for access purposes by the governing body. A private road shall be
considered that portion of a lot or parcel that is used for access purposes as
described by an easement. A private road is neither maintained by the governing
body, nor can the governing body regulate its use or contract for its
maintenance.
      5.   Prescriptive Road: A road which has judicially gained a public
character by adverse use. A prescriptive road will not be considered suitable
access for division purposes, unless it is improved to the applicable standards
set forth. The county is not responsible for improving or maintaining a
prescriptive road.
      6.   Public Road: A public road is a state highway or road, or any road
which has been dedicated to the use of the public for road purposes. "Public
road" does not include a road which has nominally or judicially gained a public
character by prescriptive or adverse use, nor does the term apply to roads
within the USDA forest service and bureau of land management (BLM) road
systems.
      7.   Service Road: A road contained entirely within property boundaries
and used for internal traffic flow. (Ord. 203 §32(210), 1987)
17.08.1065: ROAD FUNCTION:
The following definitions apply to road functions:
   A.   Principal Arterial: A road which provides for through traffic between
major centers of activity in urban, suburban, and rural areas.
   B.   Connector: A road which is used primarily as a connector from or
through local areas or districts to one or more arteries.
   C.   Local Street: The function of the local street is to provide access to
the property abutting the right of way and easements for utilities. The
movement of traffic is secondary to access. There is not through traffic.
   D.   Cul-De-Sac: A street with only one outlet, having sufficient space at
the closed end to provide vehicular turning area.
   E.   Frontage Road: A road which is parallel to and adjacent to an arterial
or other limited access road or a railroad right of way, and which provides
access to abutting properties.
   F.   Stubbed Road: A road having only one outlet, but which is intended to
be extended or continued.
   G.   Alley: A public or private way not more than thirty feet (30') wide,
affording only secondary means of access to abutting property. (Ord. 203 §32
(211), 1987)
17.08.1070: ROADSIDE STAND:
"Roadside stand" means a temporary structure designed or used for the display
or sale of agricultural products produced on the premises upon which such a
stand is located. (Ord. 203 §32(212), 1987)
17.08.1075: ROOMING HOUSE:
"Rooming house" means a building other than a hotel or motel where, for
compensation and by prearrangement for definite periods of time, lodging is
provided for individuals who are not members of a resident family. (Ord. 203
§32(213), 1987)
17.08.1080: SANATORIUM:
"Sanatorium" means a building or institution for the recuperation and treatment
of persons with physical or mental disorders. (Ord. 203 §32(214), 1987)
17.08.1085: SANITARY LANDFILL:
"Sanitary landfill" means the disposal of solid waste by compaction in or upon
land and the covering up of all waste deposited with earth or other approved
cover material at least once each operating date. (Ord. 203 §32(215), 1987)
17.08.1090: SATURDAY MARKET OR ARTS AND CRAFTS FAIR:
"Saturday market" or "arts and crafts fair" means the outdoor extended sales of
newly manufactured (handcrafted) goods, including sales of food. A manager
shall accept responsibility, supplying proof of ownership or lease arrangement.
(Ord. 203 §32(216), 1987)
17.08.1095: SCHOOL, PUBLIC AND PRIVATE:
"Public school" and "private school" means an educational institution, which
may include curriculums in kindergarten, elementary, secondary, higher
education, vocational education or special education; public schools being
those that received their support through public taxation and whose textbooks
and courses of study are under the control of the state board of education.
(Ord. 203 §32(217), 1987)
17.08.1100: SCREEN WALL:
"Screen wall" means a masonry wall or opaque fence so constructed as to prevent
the view of enclosed activities or uses from without. (Ord. 203 §32(218), 1987)
17.08.1105: SETBACK:
"Setback" means the requirement of zoning and building regulations that a
building be placed a certain distance from a street or lot line either on the
street level or at a prescribed height. (Ord. 203 §32(219), 1987)
17.08.1110: SIGN:
"Sign" means any device which identifies, describes, illustrates, or otherwise
directs attention to a product, place, activity, goods, services, person,
institution or business, or which otherwise promotes the sale of objects or
identifies objects for sale, and which is affixed to a building, structure or
the land.
This definition shall not include official notices issued by a court or public
body or officer, or directional, warning or information signs or structures
required by or authorized by law or by federal, state, county or city
authority. (Ord. 203 §32(220), 1987)
17.08.1115: SIGN, AREA OF:
In determining whether a sign is within the area limitations of this title, the
area of the total exterior surface shall be measured and computed in square
feet; provided, that where the sign has two (2) or more faces, the area of the
total exterior surface shall be measured and divided by the number of faces;
and provided further, that if the interior angle between the plans of two (2)
faces exceeds one hundred thirty five degrees (135°), they shall be deemed a
single face for the purposes thereof. Measurements shall be made at the extreme
horizontal and vertical limits of a sign. In regard to signs painted on walls
or fences, the area shall be that rectangle which would cover the sign. (Ord.
203 §32(221), 1987)
17.08.1120: SIGN, GROUND:
"Ground sign" means any sign which is supported by one or more uprights, poles
or braces in or upon the ground other than a combination sign. (Ord. 203 §32
(222), 1987)
17.08.1125: SIGN, PROJECTING:
"Projecting sign" means a sign, other than a wall sign, which projects from and
is supported by a wall of a building or structure. (Ord. 203 §32(223), 1987)
17.08.1130: SIGN, ROOF:
"Roof sign" means a sign erected upon or above a roof or parapet of a building
or structure. (Ord. 203 §32(224), 1987)
17.08.1135: SIGN, TEMPORARY:
"Temporary sign" means any sign, banner, pennant or advertising display
constructed of cloth, canvas, light fabric, cardboard, wallboard, or other
light materials, with or without frames, intended to be displayed for a limited
period of time only. (Ord. 203 §32(225), 1987)
17.08.1140: SIGN, WALL:
"Wall sign" means any sign attached to or erected against the wall of a
building or structure, with the exposed face of the sign in a plane parallel to
the plan of the wall. (Ord. 203 §32(226), 1987)
17.08.1145: SITE PLAN:
"Site plan" means a plan, prepared to scale, showing accurately and with
complete dimensioning, all of the uses proposed for a specific parcel of land.
(Ord. 203 §32(227), 1987)
17.08.1150: SKETCH OR CONCEPTUAL PLAN:
"Sketch" or "conceptual plan" means a quickly drawn plan made only after
limited study and analysis. Its function is to assemble and examine preliminary
ideas early in the planning process and to elicit response from the client or
policy makers in order to set a direction for subsequent stages of work. (Ord.
203 §32(228), 1987)
17.08.1155: SLAUGHTERHOUSE:
"Slaughterhouse" means a place where cattle, sheep, hogs, or other animals are
killed or butchered for market or for sale. (Ord. 203 §32(229), 1987)
17.08.1160: SLOPE EASEMENT:
"Slope easement" means an area adjoining a road which is affected by the road
rill or cut, but is not within the road easement or right of way. (Ord. 203 §32
(230), 1987)
17.08.1165: SOLAR ORIENTATION:
"Solar orientation" means the layout and design of parcels and sitting of a
structure on building lots to take advantage of solar insulation for optimal
utilization of the sun as an energy source. (Ord. 203 §32(231), 1987)
17.08.1170: SOLID WASTE:
"Solid waste" means all putrescible and nonputrescible refuse in solid or
semisolid form, including, but not limited to, garbage, rubbish, junk vehicles,
ashes or incinerator residue, street refuse, dead animals, demolition waste,
construction waste, solid or semisolid commercial and industrial waste. The
term does not include hazardous waste managed pursuant to Nevada Revised
Statutes 444.700 to 444.778, inclusive. (Ord. 203 §32(232), 1987)
17.08.1175: SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL SITE:
"Solid waste disposal site" means an area used for the collection, storage,
transfer, treatment utilization, or processing of waste material. "Solid waste
disposal site" includes, but is not limited to, dumps, landfills, sanitary
landfills, incineration, transfer stations, and composting and recycling
plants. (Ord. 203 §32(233), 1987)
17.08.1177: SPECIAL USE PERMIT:
A "special use permit" is a special exception to the requirements of the zoning
designation in which a property is located. A "special use permit" allows the
property owner to conduct uses which are not allowed as a matter of right
within the zoning district. It may be approved or approved with special terms
and conditions by the county commission and becomes a property right unless
revoked by the White Pine County commission. (Ord. 447, 2013)
17.08.1180: SPOT ZONING:
"Spot zoning" means the awarding of a use classification to an isolated parcel
of land which is detrimental or incompatible with the uses of surrounding area,
particularly when such an act favors a particular owner. Such zoning has been
held to be illegal by the courts on the grounds that it is unreasonable and
capricious. A general plan or special circumstances such as historical value,
environmental importance, or scenic value could justify special zoning for a
small area. (Ord. 203 §32(234), 1987)
17.08.1185: STREET:
See definition of "roads". (Ord. 203 §32(235), 1987)
17.08.1190: STRUCTURAL ALTERATION:
"Structural alteration" means any change to the supporting members of a
building including foundations, bearing walls or partitions, columns, beams,
girders, or any structural change in the roof or in the exterior walls. (Ord.
203 §32(236), 1987)
17.08.1195: STRUCTURE:
"Structure" means that which is built or constructed; an edifice or building of
any kind or any piece of work artificially built upon or composed of parts
joined together in some manner and which requires location on the ground or
which is attached to something having a location on the ground. (Ord. 203 §32
(237), 1987)
17.08.1196: STRUCTURE HEIGHT:
Total structure height for all buildings and accessory buildings including any
additional apparatus affixed to a building such as an antenna, satellite dish,
or flagpole and electrical transmission and communications facilities including
transmission lines, wind turbines, and towers and environmental testing
equipment including anemometers may not exceed two and one-half (21/2) stories
or thirty five feet (35') in height without a variance. Electrical power poles
and telephone poles that are required to deliver services to structures are
exempt from this requirement. (Ord. 454, 2014)
17.08.1200: SUBSTATION:
"Substation" means a station subordinate or subsidiary to another station.
(Ord. 203 §32(238), 1987)
17.08.1205: TAVERN:
"Tavern" means a place where the preparation, sale or consumption of alcoholic
beverages is the principal activity. (Ord. 203 §32(239), 1987)
17.08.1210: TAX LOT:
"Tax lot" means a parcel, lot, or other unit of land as created by the county
assessor for the purpose of taxation. (Ord. 203 §32(240), 1987)
17.08.1215: TEMPORARY LIVING QUARTERS:
"Temporary living quarters" means a dwelling unit which is utilized for a
specified and limited time only. (Ord. 203 §32(241), 1987)
17.08.1220: TENT:
"Tent" means a fabric shelter supported by poles or rope, which is designed for
human occupancy and to be used temporarily for recreational or emergency
purposes, but not for permanent or residential purposes. (Ord. 203 §32(242),
1987)
17.08.1225: TOWNHOUSE:
"Townhouse" means a single-family dwelling unit, on a separately platted lot,
with use and occupancy identical to all other single-family dwellings, except
without the required yard setbacks in the side yard. Fire separations are
required between each townhouse, and such required fire separation may be
obtained by two (2) separate one hour fire resistive walls, or a single masonry
wall, having a two (2) hour fire resistive rating. Such fire walls shall have
no penetrations whatsoever. Each townhouse must have separate utility services;
however, general utility services, on that land owned and maintained by a
homeowner's association, will be allowed. Each common wall shall be covered by
a set of deed restrictions. (Ord. 203 §32(243), 1987)
17.08.1230: TRAVEL TRAILER:
"Travel trailer" means a portable structure mounted on wheels, constructed on a
vehicular type of chassis primarily designed as temporary living quarters for
recreational, camping or travel use, and designed to be drawn by another
vehicle, and designated by the manufacturer as a travel trailer. A vehicle is
not a travel trailer if, when equipped for highway use, it is more than eight
feet (8') wide. (See also definition of "recreational vehicle".) (Ord. 203 §32
(244), 1987)
17.08.1235: TRAVEL TRAILER PARK:
"Travel trailer park" means a development designed primarily for transient
service on which two (2) or more travel trailers, pickup campers, tent
trailers, or similar items, or self-propelled motorized vehicles are parked and
used for the purpose of supplying to the public a temporary location while
traveling, vacationing, or recreating, including any recreating, including any
accessory buildings, structures and uses customarily incidental to such a park.
(Ord. 203 §32(245), 1987)
17.08.1240: UNIFORM BUILDING CODE:
"Uniform building code" means the latest edition of the uniform building code
published by the Pacific Coast Building Officials Conference, which has been
adopted by the city of Ely or White Pine County, as appropriate, and as it may
have been amended in its adoption. (Ord. 203 §32(246), 1987)
17.08.1245: URBAN AREA:
"Urban area" means land that is planned for urban settlement and use.
Generally, the area in which a full range of services already exist; that area
within the corporate limits of the city of Ely. (Ord. 203 §32(247), 1987)
17.08.1250: URBAN FACILITIES AND SERVICES:
"Urban facilities and services" means key facilities and appropriate types and
levels of at least the following: police protection; fire protection; sanitary
facilities; storm drainage facilities; planning, zoning, and subdivision
control; health services; recreation facilities and services; energy and
communication services; and community governmental services. (Ord. 203 §32
(248), 1987)
17.08.1255: URBAN FRINGE:
"Urban fringe" means an area at the edge of an urban area usually made up of
mixed agricultural and urban land uses. (Ord. 203 §32(249), 1987)
17.08.1260: USE:
"Use" means the purpose for which land or a structure is designed, arranged, or
intended, or for which it is occupied or maintained, whether on a permanent or
temporary basis. (Ord. 203 §32(250), 1987)
17.08.1265: USE, PERMITTED:
"Permitted use" means those uses which are allowed to occur in a zoning
district without review at a public hearing. (Ord. 203 §32(251), 1987)
17.08.1270: USE, PERMITTED CONDITIONALLY:
"Conditionally permitted use" means that use which requires a public hearing
and a decision of approval prior to issuance of a permit. (Ord. 203 §32(252),
1987)
17.08.1275: UTILITY FACILITY:
"Utility facility" means those necessary appurtenances including related right
of ways for the transmission of electric power, gas, water, sewage, telephone
and other in-line facilities needed for the operation of such facilities, such
as gas regulating stations, pumping stations, power or communication
substations, dams, reservoirs, and related powerhouses. Additionally, a utility
facility means any energy device and/or system that generates energy from
renewable energy resources, including solar, hydro, wind, biofuels, wood,
geothermal, or similar sources. (Ord. 203 §32(253), 1987)
17.08.1277: VARIANCE:
A "variance" is a special exception that allows an applicant to deviate from
the set of rules applied to land use and land development. The variance may be
approved, approved with special terms and conditions by the county commission
and becomes a property right unless revoked by the county commission. (Ord.
447, 2013)
17.08.1280: VISION CLEARANCE AREA:
"Vision clearance area" means an area adjacent to the rights of way of a road
or street which contains no sight obscuring planting, fence, wall or structure.
(Ord. 203 §32(254), 1987)
17.08.1285: WASTE DISPOSAL SITE, NONHAZARDOUS:
"Nonhazardous waste disposal site" means land used for the disposal or handling
of solid wastes, including, but not limited to, dumps, landfills, sludge
lagoons, sludge treatment facilities, disposal sites for septic tank pumping or
cesspool cleaning by the public or by a solid waste collection service and
composting plants. Nonhazardous sites do not include hazardous wastes as
defined by state administrative rule. (Ord. 203 §32(255), 1987)
17.08.1290: WORK YARD, PUBLIC:
"Public work yard" means an enclosed area for the storage of vehicles and
supplies and the provision of maintenance services for public facilities. (Ord.
203 §32(256), 1987)
17.08.1295: YARD:
"Yard" means an open space on a lot which is unobstructed from the ground
upward except as otherwise provided in this regulation. (Ord. 203 §32(257),
1987)
17.08.1300: YARD, FRONT:
"Front yard" means a yard between side lot lines measured horizontally at right
angles to the front lot line from the front lot line to the nearest point of
the building. (Ord. 203 §32(258), 1987)
17.08.1305: YARD, REAR:
"Rear yard" means a yard between side lot lines measured horizontally at right
angles to the rear lot line from the rear lot line to the nearest point of the
building. (Ord. 203 §32(259), 1987)
17.08.1310: YARD, SIDE:
"Side yard" means a yard between the front and rear measured horizontally and
at right angles from the side lot line to the nearest point of the building. In
the case of a corner lot, the side yard bordering the street shall extend from
the front yard to the rear lot line. (Ord. 203 §32(260), 1987)
CHAPTER 17.12
GENERAL PROVISIONS
SECTION:
17.12.010: Continuation Of Existing Regulations
17.12.020: Existing Uses
17.12.030: Existing Lots
17.12.040: Use Restrictions
17.12.045: Medical Marijuana Establishments (Rep. by Ord. 537, 2024)
17.12.050: Lot Areas
17.12.060: Building Height
17.12.070: Yards
17.12.080: Fences, Walls And Hedges
17.12.090: Approved Water Supply And Sewage Disposal Facilities Required
17.12.100: Special Use Permits And Variances
17.12.010: CONTINUATION OF EXISTING REGULATIONS:
The provisions of this title, insofar as they are substantially the same as
existing ordinances relating to the same subject matter, shall be construed as
restatements and continuations, and not as new enactments. The adoption of the
ordinance codified herein shall not constitute a validation of any use not
conforming with the provisions of the district in which it is located. (Ord.
203 §3, 1987)
17.12.020: EXISTING USES:
The existing use or uses of all buildings, improvements and premises not in
conformity with the standards and requirements of the zoning district in which
they are located, in accordance with the provisions of this title, and which
uses are legal, may be continued as nonconforming uses, as defined in this
title, and subject to the provisions regulating such nonconforming uses. (Ord.
203 §4, 1987)
17.12.030: EXISTING LOTS:
Where a lot has a width or area less than that required in the district of
which it is a part and was held under separate ownership, or was of record at
the time the ordinance codified herein became effective, such lot may be
occupied by uses permitted in the district, subject to the yard requirements
and such other regulations of the district. (Ord. 203 §5, 1987)
17.12.040: USE RESTRICTIONS:
   A.   Interpretation: When the term "other uses which the commission deems to
be similar" is used, it means those other uses which, in the judgment of the
commission, are similar to and not more objectionable to the health, safety and
general welfare than the uses listed in the same section. In no case shall a
use listed in a less restricted district be permitted in a more restricted
district by interpretation.
   B.   Unlawful Acts: It is unlawful for any person to erect, construct,
establish, alter, enlarge, or permit to be erected, constructed, established,
altered or enlarged, or to use or occupy or permit to be used or occupied, any
land, building or premises for any purpose or in any manner contrary to the
provisions of this title.
   C.   Consistency With State And Federal Law: Notwithstanding any other
provision of this title, any land use, activity or establishment that
contravenes either state or federal law, or both, is prohibited. (Ord. 458,
2014)
17.12.045: MEDICAL MARIJUANA ESTABLISHMENTS:
(Rep. by Ord. 537, 2024)
17.12.050: LOT AREAS:
   A.   The requirements of this title as to minimum lot area shall not be
construed to prevent the use for a single-family dwelling on any lot or parcel
of land other than in the O and M-2 districts in the event that such lot or
parcel of land was held in separate ownership at the time of adoption of the
original zoning ordinance.
   B.   No portion of any lot or parcel of land which has been designated or
used as a part of a lot area or yard as required by this title shall be
included as a portion of an area or yard for another building if such inclusion
will reduce the lot area or yard required for the original lot or parcel of
land to less than the minimum lot area or dimension of yard required for the
zoning district in which such property is located.
   C.   No lot or parcel of land held under separate ownership at the time this
chapter became effective, shall be reduced in any manner below the minimum lot
area, size or dimension required by this title.
   D.   Every building hereafter erected shall be located on a "lot" as defined
in this title. In no case shall there be more than one main residential
building and its accessory building on one lot. Dwelling groups may be
considered as one main residential building.
   E.   No building permit shall be issued for a building or structure on a lot
which abuts a street dedicated to a portion of its required width and located
on that side thereof from which no dedication was secured, unless the yards
provided on such lot include both that portion of the lot lying within the
future street and the required yards.
   F.   No parking area, parking space or loading space which is provided for
the purpose of complying with the provisions of this title, shall thereafter be
relinquished or reduced in any manner below the requirements established in
this title, unless equivalent facilities are provided elsewhere, the location
of which is approved by the commission.
   G.   Residential buildings and uses in a commercial or manufacturing
district shall maintain the area requirements of the R-M-50 district for such
building or uses. (Ord. 203 §19(B), 1987)
17.12.060: BUILDING HEIGHT:
The permitted height of buildings shall be exclusive of roof structures and
structures for the housing of elevators, stairways, tanks, ventilating fans or
similar equipment required to operate and maintain the building, and fire or
parapet walls, skylights, towers, flagpoles, chimneys, smokestacks, wireless
masts, or similar structures. (Ord. 203 §19(C), 1987)
17.12.070: YARDS:
   A.   Outside stairways, fire escapes or porches if unroofed and unenclosed
may extend into a required side yard for a distance not to exceed three feet
(3') or into the required rear yard for a distance not to exceed four feet
(4').
   B.   Cornices, canopies, eaves or other similar architectural features may
extend into a required yard not to exceed two feet (2').
   C.   Accessory buildings in a residential district shall not be permitted to
occupy more than one-third (1/3) of the total area of such rear yard.
   D.   In any M-1 district or any C districts, the following requirements
shall apply:
      1.   Residential buildings and uses shall maintain the yard requirements
of the R-M-50 district for such buildings or uses.
      2.   Where abutting any R district, a minimum side yard of a width not
less than that specified for an R-M district shall be required. (Ord. 203 §19
(D), 1987)
17.12.080: FENCES, WALLS AND HEDGES:
   A.   Fences, walls and hedges may be located in required yards as follows:
      1.   If not exceeding four feet (4') in height, such may be located in
any yard or court.
      2.   If not exceeding six feet (6') in height, such may be located in any
required rear yard or side yard, provided that on a corner lot, the rear of
which abuts the front yard of another lot in an R district, no such fence, wall
or hedge shall exceed four feet (4') in height in the exterior side yard.
      3.   On any corner lot in an R district there shall be no structure,
fences, shrubbery or obstruction to vision more than three and one-half feet
(31/2') high within twenty five feet (25') of the intersection of any two (2)
street curb lines; provided, however, that shade trees of sufficient height to
permit sight distance one street to the other under the lowest branches of
foliage thereof, may be permitted and maintained. (Ord. 203 §19(E), 1987)
17.12.090: APPROVED WATER SUPPLY AND SEWAGE DISPOSAL FACILITIES REQUIRED:
   A.   It is unlawful to locate, erect or construct any building on any lot
without provision for approved water supply and sewage disposal facilities.
Wherever an existing water and/or sewer main is accessible, connections shall
be made with such mains. In every other case, individual water supply and
sewage disposal facilities meeting the requirements of the health department
agency shall be installed under its supervision.
   B.   A certificate of approval of the proposed method of water supply and
sanitary disposal of wastes shall be obtained from the health agency prior to
the filing of the application for a building permit, and such certificate shall
accompany each such application. (Ord. 203 §19(F), 1987)
17.12.100: SPECIAL USE PERMITS AND VARIANCES:
   A.   Applications for special use permits and variances are filed with the
building and planning department. Approval of the applications is a decision of
the White Pine County commission following a public hearing.
   B.   Fees for special use permits and variances are established by
resolution by the county commission and shall cover the costs of advertisement;
mailing certified, return receipt notices to the adjacent property owners; and
recording final documents. The fee is nonrefundable if the application is
denied or the applicant decides not to proceed with the activity.
   C.   The applicant for a special use permit or variance must be the property
owner or it may be filed by the potential buyer if the application is
accompanied with a copy of an accepted offer to purchase that is contingent on
approval of a special use permit or variance.
   D.   Special use permits and variances are issued on a onetime basis and are
recorded at the White Pine County recorder's office. A special use permit or
variance is specific to the property, use, and proposed construction but can be
transferred to the new owner if the property is sold.
   E.   A special use permit or a variance remains in effect unless: 1) the
activity requiring the variance or special use permit is not initiated within
twelve (12) months of the date the permit is issued or discontinues for a
period of more than three hundred sixty five (365) consecutive days and 2) the
county commission determines that the terms of the special use permit or
variance have been violated and votes to revoke it.
   F.   All notifications and correspondence issued by the building and
planning department will be provided to the applicant in writing and sent via
certified mail. (Ord. 447, 2013)
